Typically, I am a chocolate-dessert kind of girl, but this cake was amazing. Very moist and flavorful. I have also had the Cobb Salad with Ancho Shrimp and was a great, healthier option! Great options all around.

I was actually pleasantly surprised... moving here from AZ, I was leary about trying out a Mexican restaurant but it did meet my needs. The guac made at the tableside I highly recommend. I went with the fajitas and they did not disappoint. Large amount of food as well so I had plenty to take home for leftovers. Food went nicely with an ice cold Dos Equis amber on tap!

This was the first time that we've eaten here and we really enjoyed it!  I had the pork burrito and my husband had the enchiladas and queso. The salad with the burrito was amazing   Can't wait to go back !!

Love this place! Great atmosphere and always good food and great service! I love the new location! The acoustics make it a little hard to have a conversation on busy nights, but it is ok because the food is so good, you are eating and not talking!  The cheerful and helpful staff is great!

Let me start off with that Cantina has been my favorite Mexican place in Charlotte until recently. Ever since they have moved to the Park Road shopping center they have been lacking. This use to be my go to spot with friends on the weekend and to bring out of town guests, however something has changed since they moved. I feel like they are becoming more of a chain restaurant.   The service lately has been hit or miss, but mostly miss. Last time we were there (about a month ago) we had to ask for our waiter multiple times. But the worst part was the food. The menu hasn't changed (from the looks of it), but my husband and I order the SAME thing every time and something has changed. We get the  two taco combo: Ancho Polo and Marco Polo. The last time we ordered it the tacos were either not what we ordered or they changed the way they make the tacos. It tasted like a load of coleslaw on them. And not flavorful. They just didn't taste the same. We asked our server if they changed the ingredients, but she didn't know. Plus, the black beans are now brown pinto beans. Mehhh.   Not sure what's up with Cantina lately, but we tried Paco's a few weeks ago and fell in love. I hope Cantina can step it up again.

I've eaten here three times and found it to be average at best and greatly overpriced. The complimentary chips and salsa was excellent however. The chips were thin, fresh and tasty.   Ordered the chimichanga twice and it was large and nicely prepared but $13.95?! Come on! The enchiladas were okay and priced at $8 for two and $12 for three. Service was acceptable and atmosphere, attractive. Decent beer selections.  Still, there are better choices all around...

Tonight I was hungry and was not disappointed! Excellent fresh guacamole made table side with plenty of  chips and salsa. Our chimichangas were hot and filling. We are never disappointed at Cantina 151!

Great location (right by my office) and love the decor. Went in for a long lunch and sat. Y the big windows facing the street. Menu offered a lot of options and plenty of taco combos.   The service knocks this review down to 3 and I assume this is something they will improve. However, our waitress never gave us or offered refills until she took our plates away, chips were never refilled (long lunch remember) and our food came out cold.   Will come back after they have worked out some of the hiccups

Cantina 1511, I want to love you but I cannot today.  As someone who lived in Texas for most his life and relocated to Charlotte by way of the northeast I was in great need of good Mexican.  Sadly I never got the chance due to logistics.  The food maybe good but I never got the opportunity to eat.  Upon arrival at 6pm my party of 4 were told it was to be 30 min.  Well that's acceptable.  45 min later we finally asked the status and the repose was 10 more min.  Where's the apology?  Well 10 minutes pasted and still not seated.  In actually a party of 5 whom arrived approx. 15 min after our arrival was seated.  So needless to say we walked.  A restaurant makes money on turning tables and Mexican restaurants typically do a great job at this due to the nature of Mexican food.  However, Cantina 1511 does not have logistics and management in place.  I hope to give it another go as the Mexican food choices in Ballantyne is very limited with Cantina 1511 cornering the market.  Know that my review is only to help as I want this place to succeed.

You know, I didn't have high expectations for this place but I can say that they sure do know how to cook a mean steak fajita.  The smell was so good when I walked in and I knew from looking around what I was going to get.  There comes a time in a mans life where he wants a great flavor and value.  The fajitas even had the peppers cooked just right and I don't even like peppers.  The only thing I can think of that kept me from giving a solid 5 stars would be the price.  It's a bit too pricey for what you get but others are saying this is more upscale.  I guess that's what they were going for but it's not really much more upscale than I'm used to.  Maybe I'm missing something.  The atmosphere is really welcoming and they have quick service.  The decor is newer and they have comfortable seating all around.  It was too cold to sit outside but I would have enjoyed that had it been a little warmer.  I will say this for some reason they seem to be a little slower if you are only ordering take-out which doesn't make a whole lot of since to me but hey whatever.  The chips and salsa is good it's nothing special.  The sweet tea was a bit under sweetened to my liking but the rest of my party seemed to think it was okay. What can I say I'm from Georgia and I love my sweet tea well you know sweet.  I would definitely give this spot a go.  They do reservations but each time I have been I didn't need one.  I guess it's all about the time and day you go.  Enjoy :)

Excellent Mexican food, reasonable prices and very good lite margharitas.  We were very pleased with the food, service, cleanliness and price.  Highly recommended to Mexican food fans, though I wish the music had been better.

I've been a longtime fan of this place and the margaritas. Came in on a Sunday and there was no wait which is not the norm for Charlotte. I recently have been ordering the anojittos (forgive the spelling) b/c it's the chef's pick of street food. I've never been disappointed with this pick. This time around I received friend zucchini, mini nachos, mini tostadas and churros with chocolate and what I believe to be a cherry/berry reduction. All I can say is yummy.     We also love the chips here and the salsa. The chips are thin with the perfect amount of salt. They always bring two bowls of salsa which is appreciated (especially with double dippers in your party ).

I met a friend of mine for a drink at Cantina 1511 right after work on a Wednesday.  It was just after 5 pm, and the restaurant was empty.  There were two bartenders mulling around behind the bar -- it took them about 5 full minutes to find and open 2 Coronas.   We then moved into the dining room for appetizers and drinks with a larger group.  To say the service was slow would be a vast understatement.  It took 15-20 minutes to get a drink (some margaritas, some beers), if you got them at all.  We were there for about an hour and several people had outstanding drinks that never arrived.  Did I mention the restaurant was not busy?  We also had orders of shrimp, chicken and beef skewers -- all of which were very tasty -- except for the ones with RAW chicken.  Not sort of undercooked -- but, barely cooked.  The guac was outstanding.  The 3-star rating is generous because i LOVED the Cantina 1511 on East Blvd, so I'm hoping this was just an off night.

Disappointed with the food quality. It was salty as all get out. The queso literally had no flavor. The guacamole tasted old. The kid's quesadilla was bland. And salty. And my chimichanga was greasy. Definitely won't be back.

Ok, came here on a Friday night at 5:30 (not busy at the moment) and the service thus far is sub par.  We ordered drinks which took 30 minutes.  The second round we are currently waiting on has taken another 30 minutes (still not here).  My friend has ordered wine, twice, yet still no wine... nearly ONE HOUR later.  The food may be decent, but it is clouded in with worst customer service I have ever experienced.  We have been to other locations and loved them, this was a HUGE let down.  I would go for Vida Cantina if you are headed downtown for food.

Great! If you're white and have never left home.  Seriously disappointed. Menu touts authentic Mexican food but the servers walked out of the Abercrombie and Fitch catalog and the only Brown faces are relegated to bus boys. If you're selling me Mexican food, hire Mexicans to cook it, sell it and serve it and let the white boys do the dishes. Speaking of diversity, do any African Americans work here? No, I don't want to see pics of you and your black friend.  Let's start with the salsa. Tastes like it uses canned tomato sauce. I asked for and added fresh cilantro, lime and salt and it was Not quite nearly edible.   I ordered 2 tacos: duck carnitas and Baja fish. They were both covered in some terrible pink picked onions. The duck taco had 2 extra ingredients...half an avocado and an inch long piece of bone that I had to fish out of my throat.   There are a million ways to make this taco better but step 1 would be stop trying to be so pretentious. Mexican food is humble elegance. The fish taco was unimpressive, after I excavated it from it's pickled onion tomb the fish was dry. This was served with a slaw that tasted fresh and was the only actual GOOD thing on the plate. It was also served with black beans (no seasoning, no taste) and some white rice with ugly canned peas and corn it it. Like they bought the cheapest frozen veggies they could find and threw it in.  The very white manager came by to see how I enjoyed my meal. I asked him what region of Mexico their food was from....he couldn't tell me.....he did mention all the cooks are Mexican when I told him this is white people food dressed up like Mexican food for people who have never traveled and don't know any better. He offered to comp my meal, I declined. He insisted on telling me how they roast the tomatoes for their salsa and all of the food was created by Mexican chefs.   Don't waste your money. Not authentic, flavor profiles lack cohesion and originality, if they have real Mexicans working they hide them in the lowest paying jobs while profiting off their culture.

I went with a group of friends, and there was a great atmosphere here. I didn't really care for the high stools at the table we were seated at, but there may be other options. The chips and salsa was probably some of the best I've had. The steak chimichanga I had there was pretty good. The texture was perfectly crispy, but the fillings (steak, veggies, rice) were realllly salty. Also, my bf ordered a drink, a double shot of tequila and for 9 bucks per shot, that was a $20 drink! That's a bottle! Anyway, overall it was a good night and the prices were somewhat high for casual Mexican, but I might try this place again.

I love Cantina.  This is not straight-up mexican food, so if you are lloking for grease than dont go to this restaurant.  That said, the food her is great and the portions are huge.  If you go for lunch the prices are cheaper but the portions are just as large, so I recommend lunch.   Many of their dishes come in a small or large size, so you can pick how much food you want.  Lunch can be under $10, but with drinks dinner will cost $15.  I highly recommend the chicken tostada salad and the barbicoa pork.  Half price margs on Tuesdays!!

There's no easy way to put this, after going here I feel violated.  I ordered the grilled pork loin and my wife ordered the vegetable picadillo enchiladas.  I was served two crispy burned pork loins floating in a bland "peanut" sauce that tasted like it belonged more on a Thai menu.  The plate was over sauced, the "queso mashed potatoes" were bland and as hard as a rock...  Then there were the slightly burned, out of season asparagus, no crisp to them, just limpy old food.  To make matters worse, my wife's dish was inedible.  She was served, no joke, instant rice with dried peas and carrots.  They at least squeezed some lime juice on it.  The vegetables in the soggy tortillas were over cooked to the point that they were little rubber bits of bitter tasting vegetables.  We're not picky eaters, but this honestly was an insult served to us on a plate.  I would have sent it all back but our server quickly grabbed our plates and bagged it up for us after she saw we weren't eating.  This was honestly the worst meal I have ever been served that came out of a professional kitchen.  Take my advice, drive five more minutes down the road and go to Senor Tequila.

I had been craving guacamole for about a week and me and my sister decided on Cantina to help me sate that craving.  we got there around 7 and it was pretty busy, but I had made a reservation before we left the house.  They have $10 off pitchers of any margaritas on Thursday's, so we got the house and my guac to start.  Pitcher was huge!!  I really wasn't expecting it to be so big and with just the 2 of us it was too much.  We were both so full from liquids that I barely ate dinner, which was the barbacoa.  Guac was pretty good, maybe too much lime juice though.  Barbacoa was good, never had it before but it did seem a bit dry to me, still tasty though.  Sister got garlic shrimp, tasted like scampi but they were yummy.  Dessert was quatros leches, good but they put a meringue top on it and it was not needed and we scraped it off.  Our server was great and made sure our water was never empty and we had plenty of chips.  Only thing that was annoying, and is totally my fault, I had a Citi Pass coupon and didn't realize till the next day so we could have gotten 1 entree freeish.  Oh well my fault for never remembering to check that book!!

I've been here a few times. It seems like I go about every 6 months because it takes about that long to forget the prior experience.   I had the Chimichanga (fried burrito). There is no way that it is better than the Qdoba across the parking lot. It's basically the same thing. But this is true of a lot of Mexican food - it seems like you pay double if it comes with a plate. Someone has to wash a plate. So maybe that makes sense.  3 people - no alcohol - no drinks (water) - no appetizer - 3 entries and the bill including tip was over $50.00. Fast food Mexican without the plate for the same meal would have been less than $20.00.  Maybe it will be better 6 months from now - I'll keep you posted !

The chips were delivered quickly and were light, crispy and warm, the guacamole made table side was awesome - fresh (of course) and very spicy! We each had a margarita on the rocks, one Corona and we split the steak fajitas - total bill $58 with tip - not bad but I would have expected a little less splitting an entree. oh well.   The atmosphere was fun - got lucky with the leftover snow and ice outside b/c we were seated without having to wait even though the restaurant was mostly full.   Service was excellent. Good casual date spot.   My only gripe was that the fajitas needed a little more meat in addition to the ample amount of veggies - otherwise Cantina would have gotten 4 stars.

Food is good...Service was terrible.  My husband and I had to ask 4 times (asked different people still no silverware,  one person even said they were washing it, guess they need to raise the silver pare level here) to get silverware to eat our meal with.  It got so bad that my husband asked a different server walking by our table if they even have any silverware, by the time we got silverware our food was cold) Absolutely NO manager presence on the floor at all.  Restaurant really is good food wise but the management team is not doing anything to make the service/dining experience work.  Try replacing management or at least have them visible to the patrons and then train the service staff.

Sorry kids, after hearing many people raving about this place, my girlfriend and i finally decided that we needed our Mexican fix. We love Mexican food, but apparently we have become too accustomed to the run of the mill 'authentic' Mexican food. Not the Chipotle or Moes, but the sit-down  restaurant with menus with wet burritos and a listing of 30+ numbered dishes.  i had a traditional Mexican dish, while she had  a Tex Mex burrito. Her burrito was huge, but she only eat a few bites, It just wasn't good. i had the traditional enchiladas and they were slightly more edible, however, we wouldn't go back for either dish. The beans were like a bad bean soup, the rice didn't have much taste (other than the peas mixed in),   The atmosphere was great and the server was very attentive and i really wanted to like the place, but i can't say i'll be back.

The service was excellent, so was the food: we had the guacamole, the pork belly tacos and the nachos for starters. Everything was delicious and came out promptly, specially the pork belly tacos. I had tacos, duck, beef and Texas, delicious as well.

We stopped in for lunch today, service was Ok honestly nothing to complain about. The food was another story, I ordered creamy chicken enchiladas they were just gross. They were not at all creamy, the chicken was just compacted inside the enchilada and tasted old, not creamy at all. They topped it with circles of dried up red onion.. why? Definitely way too dry for "creamy" chicken. I also tried to use a teachers discount which they eventually accepted but said that it would not be valid in the future. If you want to end a coupon that's fine but just end it! Don't leave it up on my employee app then tell me it's just supposed to be just for a kid's back to school special and threaten to not accept it. It was specifically for the park road location... I just don't like being made to feel like a beggar when I try and use a teacher discount as advertised.

Still one of our favorite Tex-Mex spots!  The new location is not as intimate as the East Blvd location (the only reason this is not a 5 star rating) but they are able to accommodate more customers, so the trade-off for me is worth it.  I have never been disappointed with the meals or the service and the guacamole is consistently outstanding!  One time our server even stopped in the middle of the table-side guacamole prep and said he could not finish since the avocados he selected were not perfectly ripe.  He promptly returned with new avocados and delivered perfection in a bowl that was spiced exactly to our taste.  Very impressive!  The predominant style is indeed Tex-Mex which is my favorite but I understand it may not suit everyone.  That said there are a few "authentic Mexican" dishes that my wife gravitates toward and she is as big a fan of Cantina 1511 as I am.  Enjoy, but plan to get there early on Friday evening if you want to be seated quickly.

Food was horrible and service was not good... Our waitress disappeared half way through our meal...  The fajitas where not cooked very well... He chicken was not cooked all the way... The tortillas where cold.... Horrible experience....

I've been here many times, but after my most recent meal the other night I figured it's about dang time I write a review.  Simply put, this place is great.  If you like guacamole, this is the place for you.  They make it at the table while you watch, and you can have it seasoned to your taste.  It's a bit pricey to get the guacamole, but it's pretty delicious.  Just be prepared because you'll get a LOT of guac.  If you don't like the guacamole, you will probably be pretty satisfied with the complimentary salsa.    If you like tequila, you have come to the right place.  There are plenty of different types and there is a good variety of margaritas.  I am more of a beer man, myself.  There aren't a lot of drafts to choose from, but they have Dos Equis Amber and when I'm eating Mexican food that is good enough for me.  So what really inspired me to write this review was the dish I had the other night, the barbacoa de puerco.  I cannot believe I've been to Cantina so many times without trying this thing but it was amazing.  The dish consisted of slow cooked, shredded pork with pico, guacamole, and charro beans and rice.  The pork was tender, juicy, flavorful, and delicious.  It came with flour tortillas to load up with the meat and sides.  It possibly the best Mexican meal I've had.    If you aren't interested in the barbacoa, I'd recommend to get some tacos.  There are about 10 different types so there's something for everyone.    In conclusion, if you like Mexican food you need to go here.  Be sure to make a reservation if you're going on Friday or Saturday.  If you don't, you will likely be waiting for a while.  Standing around waiting for 45 minutes watching the waiters carry around the delicious looking and wonderful smelling hot plates is a torturous experience.

The atmosphere was great, we were in and out in an hour, on Saturday night. Table side guacamole was great, it would have been nice to have a choice of spice/hot level. The Birdsong Jalapeño APA (American Pale Ale), was a great beer, it is a full body beer with a hint of pepper that fads away, making it easy to drink. My wife got the house margarita (frozen) and said it was one of her favorites.

This place is not your ordinary Mexican Food place. It had a concept like Chilis/Applebee's where you order 3 - appetizer, entree, dessert to share. Not sure if it's a regular concept, but it does save money. (Not that I eat at either of those places, but I am familiar. ;)) They make the at the table guacamole which was really tasty and fresh. I'm not sure if this is a chain, but I'm almost certain it's not the owners first restaurant because it was run efficiently and well. They have Sunday Ticket so you can see the games, and plenty of TV's which was great. Whether you're with a group or just a partner, this is a great spot. Lots of drink options as well, the margaritas were good, and their low quality tequila is still 100% agave. As for quality, it's absolutely worth the price. Waitress was attentive and nice, I'd recommend the restaurant.

Oh, Cantina 1511, how you bring out the Mexican fiesta in me!    I've just had wonderful dining experiences here and I would highly recommend it for a few venues:  1) girls or boys night out 2) laidback, but not too casual first date 3) celebration evening (i.e. birthday, anniversary)  Quick and dirty review:  1) Excellent, tasty food.  You must get the guacamole.  The waiter will make it right at your table with fresh, whole ingredients. 2) Service was outstanding.  Waiter was attentive, but sure not to rush us (even during restuarant week when the wait was over an hour). 3) Prices won't kill your wallet.  You're likely to even leave with leftovers.  Gotta love 2 meals for 1.   4) Drinks are very yummy. 5) Atmosphere is casual yet not too informal.  My only complaint is that during busy hours parking is very scarce.  Although, if you have a few bucks you can vallet!    Muy bueno, Cantina!
My boyfriend and I come to Cantina often just to sit down and have their fresh tableside guac! Their food and service is always spot on and we never leave disappointed or hungry

It has been years since I have been to Cantina 1511 (the other location on East Blvd).  Food review: The chips were over salty and greasy.  The guacamole made fresh at the table was pretty good, I only wish it had some more tomatoes in it.  My meal was not very good - the chicken and spinach enchiladas.  They were really bland.  Not much seasoning.  I had to dump a bunch of salsa on they to even be interested in eating my meal.  The beans seemed like they were not totally cooked all the way, as they were sort of hard.     Quite honestly, I remember the food being better at the other location.  Maybe I caught them on a bad night?  Or maybe the other location is better.
This place is way over priced and food taste terrible. Definitely don't get the cheese dip taste like cardboard.

The food: I ordered the crab & avocado quesadilla, some queso & chips.... Whew! Lots of food! I did not finish it all. The quesadilla was REALLY good! The crab tasted like real crab, not imitation crap. The queso was awesome, came with it's own flame under the fondue bowl to keep the queso hot.   The Decor: Great! The patio is really nice. They have one long table for large groups.   The service: JULIANNA was my attentive, but not annoying waitress. She kept my drinks flowing and always had a smile when passing by my table.   Recommend? Yes especially for groups...

It's.so. Bad. When this place was on east blvd I only went twice and truly thought the food was not impressive. It's been at park rd shopping center now for a while and I have been several times in an attempt to give it another chance. Every time I go the food is awful. I tried 3 different tacos tonight and I couldn't even finish two of them, not to mention there was a random shrimp in one of them, which was an allergy hazard. Shelley was awesome, funny, personable and very sweet. Otherwise, in the future I will not succumb to a couples dinner here when suggested

Just meh. This place has changed so much since they were at the East Blvd. location. The food quality has definitely gone down; the people I were with also all felt the same way. I ordered the carne asada tacos which were room temperature and bland when they were brought out. I asked the waiter for cheese for that tacos and later found out I was charged $1.00 for the cheese. I thought cheese was a required taco topping but I guess not at Cantina 1511. Pros were that the mimosa I ordered was made well and the service was fairly quick.

We were in a large party and they had the best little 7 layer salad to go with the chips and salsa. Our waiter said he never saw them before, so I don't know how we lucked up on that! They also did steak and chicken fajitas and I loved the steak and my sis loved the chicken. I wish I had one for leftovers now. Mmmm.   Service was great, even though I'm sure our party of people in and out to smoke and whatnot was annoying. The parking is pretty bad, but free after 6 and the bathroom needed a little attention.

There was a 45 minute wait time on a Friday evening, but we got our table as promised. The menu was an interesting mix of authentic Mexican food and Mexican burgers. We went for the usuals, tacos, Fajitas and the burger. Our waitress was extremely friendly and provided us a great hospitality. There are hardly few waitresses who would care for your well being, she was one of them. Forgot to get her name. The chips and salsa were not the best but medium sized and okay. The food came in without much delay. I got the El Diablo burger and it was a killer! Double patty and super spicy! I tried but couldn't complete the whole burger in one sitting. Overall we had a good experience. And for an upscale restaurant that looked really fashionable it wasn't that expensive. 30 to 40$ for food and drinks for two! Great deal I would say. If you wouldn't mind the wait time, I say check it out!
Love coming here, especially for margs on the patio! Good food and friendly staff every time!

I decided to give this place a try because I was hungry and it was right across the street from where I was shopping. Even though I should have know better by now that most of "authentic" Mexican food in Charlotte has not been good or authentic. I ordered the enchiladas Tejanos because the description sounded good. However, the best part of the meal were the beans. The "oaxaca' cheese tasted nothing like real oaxaca but reminded me of gooey monterrey jack. I have never tasted barbacoa that is these sweet. In my opinion, Chipotle's barbacoa is more authentic. I just can not like the flavors that I've found in the so called Mexican food joints around here. I will stick to the few hole-in-the-wall spots for my Mexican food.
Lived here for three years and just discovered this place. Amazing!  I grew up in Los Angeles so I know good ethnic food.  WOW!!!

My husband and I dined here on a Sunday evening. We arrived at 7:30pm after seeing a movie at the Regal in the same complex. What a disappointment honestly! We didn't select this restaurant based off of Yelp reviews, but instead we came here out of convenience.  We started off ordering two house margaritas on the rocks, 1 with salt and 1 without. Both came with salt and I was disappointed but didn't even point it out to the waiter because I didn't want to be "that person."    We didn't order an appetizer because we had popcorn at the theater so we smacked on the complimentary chips and salsa which were tasty. Chips were crisp and lightly salted. Salsa may have been jarred or homemade but had a kick to it.   We decided to try the date night special for $25 where we could each pick an Entrée from a limited menu and then could share a dessert. I ordered a chimichanga with steak and specifically asked for no sour cream. My husband ordered a chimichanga with chicken with everything on it.   The food came out about ten minutes later. (Almost too fast?) The waiter handed me what seemed to be the correct plate until we cut into it and found they reversed our orders. So then we had to switch plates and I had to scrape the sour cream off of mine. This may not seem like a big deal however the sour cream was touching the slaw and lettuce in addition to touching the beans and queso that was spilling over the chimichanga. I personally abhor sour cream so I was really annoyed.    Then I noticed I had about a teaspoon of guacamole on my plate AND no pico de Gallo. Meanwhile my husband had generous portions of each. I was pretty annoyed at this point. The waiter bought me a tiny thing of pico de gallo which was appreciated. Honestly the food wasn't very good anyway and the guacamole tasted pretty bland.   The churros that accompanied the meal took longer than the meal did to come out and that's probably because they were over fried. The Melba sauce served on the side tasted like something poured out of jar or bottle and was extremely sweet.    All in all, I was very disappointed with attention to detail and the taste/quality of the food served. We will not be back.

I love avocados, but after eating a ton of this goodness with this restaurant's delicious, made at your table guacamole, seeing a thick slice of fatty avocado on top of every other part of my meal was a bit overmuch.   But get the guacamole. The spinach enchiladas were also good, if very cheesy. The black beans were a little salty.  The corn fritters were talked up by our server, but they didn't really deliver, and I'm unsure I would serve them as a desert. The peach dessert was much better, probably because we are in Cackalack while they are in season!  The service was outgoing and friendly, helpful and quick to attention. Good service.  This is Mexican that is supposedly fancified, but it seems mostly you're just paying more for stuff that seems to be modestly better than the cheap, gut-busting stuff. Try it for yourself, but I'm going to keep lookin!

Happy hour: Amazing, Cheap, and Drinks! I came here for a happy hour with a friend of mine (which was really a failed party, which became like a default date...) The appetizers were filling, and the drinks weren't too bad on the price. I think that there should have been a little bit more space, except I wasn't too worried about it because it was just the two of us.  Overall, I would come here for happy hour itself. South Charlotte isn't quite my scene so I don't think I would get to try out the other dinner options. We'll see if that changes though.
Roger was attentive. Food was amazing. Even got a margarita and it was on point! Could not be happier with my experience. Always good when I go somewhere, enjoy the food, and so does my kid.

Is it the BEST Mexican spot out there?  Probably not, but it is VERY good! You have to get an order of guacamole- its pretty darn good. All the dishes are great, again, never had a bad meal here. Very busy at night, but don't let it stop you; its in a great neighborhood to explore for a bit if you have to! Good Chips n' Salsa Descent size bar- but can be very crowded. Parking can be tight too- all depends on when you go. The neighborhood is Dilworth
It's not often my family finds a place that everyone loves. Usually, someone won't eat.... Well, not this time.. Everything was awesome food, service and they easy to find.

I've been here three times, and each time I've never been disappointed. The fish tacos are delectable, the chopped salad is delicious and I usually end up eating so much of their awesome salsa and chips that I barely have room for my entree. I've tried the Salmon al Pastor and both the presentation and flavors are wonderful. The only reason I'm giving it four stars instead of five is because I've been told they're working on adding to the menu so I'm waiting for this place to be even more awesome.
The Cobb salad with salmon is delish. Got the cuatro leches cake for the table. Perfect way to end a great meal.
Best fajitas and burritos! My girlfriend and I love Cantina for Sunday lunch! Great margarita made with fresh juice! We like to sit in the bar so we can watch football.

So I've never actually sat down and had a full meal here before, but I do enjoy any place with chips, salsa, and margaritas.  The chips and salsa are great. Queso is pretty on point, but only if you like Parmesan cheese. Guac is made in front of you. If you like spicy I recommend getting the hot because the medium is not spicy at all.  Margaritas could be stronger.

What a horrible place. I'm sorry to see this open up in Park Road Shopping Center. I've been twice, and the infractions upon standard treatment of human beings is atrocious. I'm not one to give bad reviews, but this is not my kind of restaurant. Awful customer service, attention to detail, acknowledgement that you've even come *in*. The list goes on.

Good food (chicken chichanga rocked), good atmosphere, nice servers, overall a good experience. A tad high in price and don't expect a huge portion but the taste and quality are excellent.  You won't be disappointed.

My friends and I stopped by today for lunch. The service was average-- I wasn't floored by our waiter, but he wasn't awful or anything and our food came out quite quickly. We ordered queso fundido for the table, the cheese had a nice consistency and stretch, but there was a smokiness to it that I wasn't really vibing with. I ordered the chimichanga with steak and it was just okay, kinda heavy on the rice and beans and not much else. My friends ordered the tostada salad and the avocado hamburger, both of which seemed to be hits. Overall, it was an average experience with average food. There are other options nearby that I enjoy a little more, so I'm definitely not tripping over myself to go back anytime soon.

Wow I was sad I had to write a poor review for the resturant I had high hopes. First the atmosphere was nice,clean and relaxing. The service was great but the food was over the top salty. I love mexican food and I can eat it everyday but not here. I enjoyed the salsa but the chips were to salty the the dinner which was nachos it taste like I was eating nothing but salt. I am not sure why this was. I had to drink alot of water to flush out my body. Would I try again probably not I just had better and not worth the drive for me.

WHY ???  did you change the chips?????    So disappointed last night.  We went to Cantina instead of On the Border just because of the chips and salsa. Now you've gone and changed the chips.  The old ones were better!!!!!!   Please change back.

Went to Cantina 1511 over the weekend and have been there a few other times over the last year; we've literally had the exact same experience every time: painfully bad service and decent Mexican food. This location is seriously in my no fly zone just based off how bad the service is here. Our food has always taken way longer than it should and some part of our order is inevitably screwed up. The wait staff and front desk are super friendly, but god help me something needs to change about the dine-in service.   Aside from the service, Cantina 1511 doesn't do anything particularly well. The Margaritas are usually over-priced and too sugary. The food is fine, but not anything better than any other Mexican restaurant int the Charlotte area. Truthfully, the only reason we went this weekend was because it was close, and we are SUPER lazy.   I wouldn't necessarily recommend against Cantina, but I wouldn't go out of my way to tell people to go here.

Margarita please!  I like this place!  Service is good, food is good, margaritas are great!  I love that the skinny margaritas aren't full of fake sweeteners but literally a smaller version of the regular.  The guacamole is tableside and good but make sure they don't try to put unripened avocados in there... They've tried it once.  I just love the mushroom tacos.  A nice fresh spin on veggie tacos.  The outdoor seating is nice a spacious and quiet during the day if you need to get some work done!  The salads are tasty too... Jicama makes everything taste better imo...  Still my go to spot in stonecrest... Keep up the good work

Got the orange duck and it was very close to 4 stars. My only complaint is the duck was a bit fatty and tough. The salsa on top was fresh and tasted a bit like lime. The rice was fluffy, light and very fresh as well. The black beans on the side was so so; not bad or good. The guacamole is made in front of you; very fresh. The only reason I didn't give this place 4 stars is the duck could have been less fatty.  I would come here again.

I've tried very hard to give this place a chance, but after THREE visits, I just can't anymore.  The last time I went was last Friday, 11/11/2016, the Friday after election day.  The first drink I had was the Cadillac, their signature margarita.  It was so sweet, it took me a very long time to get through it.  For 16$, I expect my drink to be top notch delicious and to the standard expected.  Nothing close.  The second drink I ordered was a regular margarita, with patron tequila.  A diffferent drink  HAS to be better.  Absolutely WORSE!  It was SO SICKLY sweet, I could only get through 1/4 of the drink, and I LOVE my drinks.  I even let my boyfriend try a sip, and he is a non-drinker and a bad choice to be a critic because he doesn't like alcohol that much.  He LOVED the fact that it was SO sweet, which is a TERRIBLE indicator.  Nevertheless, we left there with 3/4 of my expensive patron margarita.  I ordered the street pizza which was on the app menu for 10$.  It was just OK.  I ate 2 slices and left the rest.  My bf ordered the beef and chicken fajitas.  I tried the beef and it was very chewy, not tender in any way.  I had the shrimp fajitas the time before when we were there and they were decent, but nothing to write home about or give a great review for.  The sides that the fajitas come with are ok, You get a group of sliced carrots with cheese, lettuce and some guac.  No rice or beans unless you order those separately,, but you still pay a premium price for the plate.  Its sad because I wanted to really like this place, but just can't.  I would choose any mexican spot in Charlotte over Cantina 1511.  The food quality for such an expensive price, along with the drinks as well (well, if you know the bartender working that night, or know who he/she is/was, then they were HORRIBLE!!!!! and need to know that!!!) in such a cool hot spot is totally NOT worth any of it.  I don't even think my rating should be poor at 2 stars, it really should be TERRIBLE, 1 star.  Cantina 1511, you need to revamp everything if you want to continue to do decent business.  I'm so sorry and disappointed that it is this bad.  :(
Went for lunch. Service was great. Love their salsa which is big for me. The food was average in my opinion but I'll be back.

Average Tex Mex restaurant, don't expect anything to waw you.... The staff are great, Brad was awesome. If you live in the area and you're up for some bland filling Tex Mex meal than go for it, portions are healthy...

Stopped here after an event at the Mint museum. Since I was with the kiddo's we ordered the nacho's with beef, along with mahi mahi taco's for me. Nacho's were immense and loaded - big enough for four people! The homemade queso was great, btw.   Fish taco's were ok, but I've had better in CLT. Overall vibe is great here, service was average.

Girls day out! We started with the table side guacamole, and queso. Both were great. I had the choose 2 taco combo, with the gobernador tacos, black beans and rice. The shrimp in the tacos were plump and juicy. The salsa and slaw that accompanied were wonderful.   Washed it all down with a orange Tijuana taxi, with a gran marnier side car. Excellent meal, we'll be back!
Not really impressed. It's placed had been talked up by so many people I knew and was just pretty average to me. Definitely willing to try it again.

Wow...  Had not been in a few years, an my how things have changed.  Our server (Jessica) did not have a clue as to how to wait tables.  I am not sure if it was lack of training or simply her lackadaisical demeanor.  There were crushed chips under at least 40% of the tables with no effort to clean between diners.  We were given some "gluten free" chips and told they were out of regular chips.  WOW!!  Later in the meal these BAGGED chips were swapped out with not fresh fried but room temperature house made chips.  The server took my empty glass to refill my tea.  While she was away with my glass a server delivered our food, we at that point asked for silverware.  WOW!!  Jessica passed our table five times without returning my tea.  Twelve minutes later after she had passed the fifth time she returned with another glass of tea.  Cheese dip was good, and dinner was very good.  Though not what I ordered with the server.  Food is well worth the trip, but doubt I will be returning due to the extremely poor service.

First and foremost I have been to Cantina 1511 before and the food and service has always been fantastic but today I went and had a horrible experience. I decided to stop in by myself to order some food, once I was seated and placed my order I went to the restroom to wash my hands why is it that a waitress that wasn't mine cleared my appetizer and drink from my table? She brought me out another one and said she was sorry so I let it go, but when my food came out I found debris in it, the waiter stated that he would have another plate remade for me so when the next plate came out there was a long piece of hair wedged in the meal, needless to say my appetite was destroyed and I left the restaurant, Cantina 1511 is definitely off my eating list.

Wow! With all of the great reviews, including Zaguts, I was really disappointed. I gave 2 stars b/c the server was great. The food....well, the salsa was too salty, taking away from the blend of flavors; the chips were very greasy(undoubtedly the reason for my upset stomach the rest of the day...oh, we went for lunch); I chose 1 of the 2 most popular maragrita's (so the waiter said)...not the 1511, but his other recommendation.  BORING!! And yes, good tequlia is smooth, especially w/the right mixers, but this was just flat in so many ways. I had the soft chicken taco lunch w/beans only, however they put abt 1 tablespoon of slaw on my plate. The meat was dry and tasted like a dirty grill, the drizzeled sauce was some horrible sweet mayo concoction. Not my favorite.

I was expecting to be a little more blown away by Cantina especially since its one of Charlotte's more established Mexican restaurants but I found it be all right.  I joined my friend for some margaritas on a Saturday evening (the place wasn't busy at all at 5:30ish). We started with the complimentary chips and salsa - both excellent! nice crunchy, slightly salty chips and salsa with a little bit of a kick, just the way I like it! We also decided to go for the tableside guac - nice and chunky but could've used a tad more salt/lime.   I decided to go with the Pina (pineapple) margarita and my friend had the strawberry. Both deliciously strong!! I went with the two taco combo: fish & pork tacos. I was slightly disappointed in their refried beans and rice. Neither were particularly indicative of traditional Mexican beans and rice and the portion was teeny tiny!   I don't know if I'll be rushing to go back as I can always count on my trusty Paco's to make an even better marg and taco but I won't count out Cantina

Interesting concept. I was genuinely impressed by this place. I ordered the lunch steak quesadillas and they were pretty good.   What stood out from me was the level of service by our waitress. She knew just about everything i asked her and she was very attentive to my needs. 5 stars for her.   My 1511 margarita with herradura tequila was average at best. It was way too sour for my taste.   This place is much more expensive than most mexican restaurants. $17 for steak fajitas seems a little overkill for me. Overall though not a bad place.

Ok. So pretty amazing lunch today. Went with some work colleagues. Today they had a little exhibition of some live entertainment. Apparently they have something going on every day of the week. We had the table side Guac which is made to your level of spice. I needed more and they brought me out a side of Serrano peppers. Ask for the habanero salsa if you really want to kick it off. They also have 9.95 lunch specials which include a drink. I had the two Barbacoa tacos. If you have not tried their barbacoa. You must. I will definitely be back.

Had lunch there today (Thursday). Food was great which is why I gave them 3 Stars. My recommendation is not to sit in the bar. The bartender, never gave his name and seemed distant, and distracted. Almost unapproachable. I felt I was imposing asking for more iced  The salsa had a little extra heat which I enjoyed.  Chips were crisp and yummy. I had the mushroom quesadilla  which was outstanding.  Like I said, I wouldn't recommend sitting in the bar area unless you have to. This was not my first visit and I've never seen this particular bartender. But he was so off putting that I felt others should know. Stay away from the bar on Thursday mornings. Other than that I highly recommend.

In the beginning We placed our name to be seated and we were skipped, when we went to the desk to check why, they rudely said it was our fault that they have been texting us multiple times. When I did not get messages and showed the lady in the desk that I only received the one text message that let us know we checked in, they then apologized and sat us after being so rude. If we would had not noticed who knows how long we would have been sitting outside waiting. We ordered the queso and didn't get the tortillas that go with it, we asked one of the waitresses to bring the tortillas and she never did so we asked someone else to and she did bring them. Waitress kept skipping us when she was doing rounds for her table section. Also after being so frustrated after this meal the sugar rim margarita I ordered was a bitter salt rim! This was my first experience and definitely my last one at cantina 1511. The only highlight of my experience was the bar staff, they were so awesome and nice. They didn't know how to make my drink but did their best to provide me what I asked for.

Another nice meal at 1511. The red sangria and los 1511 marg hit the spot. The salsa and chips were excellent and our mains of chicken quesadillas and chicken enchiladas were tasty and well prepared.  The service was excellent as well.

Cantina, pull it together. I was super excited to try the new Park Road location and even more excited that they were opening for weekend brunch, but this experience was one miss after another. I'm hoping it's just because they're in a new location and trying to get acclimated, but...  We got there on a Sunday at 9:00 am when they open, and I wasn't sure we'd walked in the correct door because there was a ladder in the lobby and numerous cardboard boxes, and construction workers were milling around. A guy walked up to me, and I asked if they were open; he said they were, gave us his name (but I still have no idea if was the owner, manager, etc.), and proceeded to take us on a tour of the new location. Call me cranky, but it's early on a Sunday morning, and I haven't had any coffee - just seat me and feed me! He let us pick where to sit, which some might appreciate, but I can't make decisions before coffee, and the new location is so huge, I felt overwhelmed. He also came over again mid-meal to tell the fella how they have TVs and the NFL Sunday Ticket in case he's into football or fantasy football.   Our waiter was super weird. He kept trying to pronounce the words on the menu in Spanish (being funny?), so he asked us how we liked the "Mehican" food and tried rolling his r's. It was awkward to say the least. He rarely made eye contact with us because he was watching the TV over our shoulder. He also never refilled our drinks, and when I finally asked about more coffee, he forgot. I waited and waited, and when I finally saw him again, he told me they were out of coffee and it was brewing. This was at 9:25 when they'd been open for 25 minutes, there were literally 4 people in the place, and one of them - the fella - wasn't even drinking coffee. The cup he finally brought me was so bad I couldn't even drink it. Thankfully the waitress for other couple saw that we were out of water and refilled that.  Onto the food... I got the Mexican Lager Pancakes with bananas, scrambled eggs, and bacon. The bacon was way spicier than I'd planned on, but the pancakes were good. The banana slices come in the batter (much like they do other places), but our waiter made a scene out of yelling to the kitchen staff that there were no bananas, and then he made me cut into my pancakes to prove that they were in there. For. The. Love. The fella got the Chorizo Burrito, which was deliciousy cheesy. Oddly enough, our waiter brought chips and salsa to our table... at 9:00 a.m.  Alllll that said, the new location is bright and spacious, and I'm glad for the ample parking. I'll try again, but not for a loooong time til I let you guys try it out and give me the "all clear" to go back.

Always busy, this East Boulevard restaurant has great food. Best thing on the menu- Barbacoa! Order it as an entree, or in tacos. They have a top shelf /handcrafted margarita menu that produces outstanding drinks.   Table-side Guacamole is the best in town!   Perfect spot to meet friends and enjoy some terrific food. And, if you need it, they have a kids menu.  Also, th eparking lot is fairly small, but valet parking is usually available at the front door.
The food is just ok. The drinks are the only reason to go in my book. The blood orange margarita is amazing. I have tried several things but not hit has ever been outstanding there.

This place used to be a hit for me on east blvd, but no longer does it for me with the new location.  The previous location had more of a fancy, small location type of feel to it.  The new location is definitely more accommodating, but has lost what was previously mentioned.  Now it feels more like a big, open, casual, and loud atmosphere.  I can't help but compare Cantina to Paco's Taco's down in South Park, which at this point has Cantina beaten in pretty much every meaningful way for me.  The food is tastier, the vibe is classier, and dollar for dollar it is cheaper.  Also, no more duck tacos?  Why remove such a great thing?

I've eaten at Cantina 1511 Uptown several times, have had them cater 2 of my parties and recently attended the karaoke night with some friends. I love this place. The food is delicious, their guacamole is the best in town and their margaritas are on point! Highly recommend Cantina for lunch, dinner, catering or a night out!

I was really excited to learn about there skinny margaritas and the fresh made table side guacamole! My husband got salmon and potatoes and they where seasoned perfectly! I got the chicken burrito and it was ginormous! Chips and fresh salsa are served when you sit down.
Excellent Guacamole, terrific Margueritas and delicious entrees.  Love Canting 1511

Cantina, which serves upscale Mexican food with an interesting twist, is a great place to go for a nice date.   I so enjoy the chicken burrito - generously topped with a queso sauce - that I pretty much always get that.  My boyfriend really likes the Tacos Marco Polo (shrimp, bacon, and caramelized onion's in flour tortillas with pico de gallo and melted cheeses).   The margaritas are awesome. I'd recommend getting a pitcher for your table. While every table gets chips and two kinds of salsa, I'd also suggest ordering the guacamole. The water mixes up the fresh avocados and other ingredients right at your table.   Cantina isn't just a restaurant - it's an experience. Because it's so good, it's packed most nights. Call ahead and make a reservation or it could be a long wait.

Not a very good experience.  We went there to celebrate my daughter. Went with a couple that had a 5 month old baby.  When we got there it was not busy at all since it was about 515.  Our waitress wasn't bad, but our food took forever. It probably took over an hour. At that point in time the baby wasn't happy, we weren't hungry because we ate so many chips and salsa. The food wasn't bad, but wasn't great either. The manager did apologize and gave us this weird dessert that no one liked. The store was not busy at all, and we saw a lot of other people looking around for their food too.  Would not recommend to go go any later, if this was the case at 515.
Good job! We went to old one on East Blvd & it was horrible. Here, it was great! Live music, fresh food, great new decor, friendly staff. We will be back!

We came here with a bunch a friends and had a real good time. Service was great as they were able to accommodate 8 of us with no problem.  The food was just as good. I had the shrimp skewer dinner which was really good and just what I expected. We also had 3 pinchers of margaritas too. Gotta have my margaritas lol.    No one in my group had any issues and we had an overall good time. This place is definitely recommended!!

This restaurant has it's pluses and minuses. With Yelp, we made reservations for 7:00 on the patio. We were seated within 10 minutes on a busy Saturday. The new location is much nicer, airier than the East Blvd. location. I really love the atmosphere and decor. Our waitress was pleasant. I ordered a house margarita which was sweet and not very strong. For dinner, I had the Marco Polo tacos. The tacos were excellent. However, the rice and refried beans were dry and bland. For atmosphere and service, I give it a 5. For food and drinks, I give it a 3.5. So I averaged it out to a 4.

Love this place! Service is always prompt. Food comes out quickly. Quality of food is excellent. I've been to Cantina multiple times and will continue to go.   The atmosphere of this restaurant is warm and enjoyable.   Prices keep me from rating it five stars, however, the food is worth the price.

My wife & I met some friends here for dinner tonight & we've been to this location a handful of times.   I was expecting a wait, given the weekend & this place is usually packed. The couple we were meeting got there before us & had already put in for the table. We waited around 35-40 minutes or so & were then sat. That's typical...  We sat at our table for around 20 minutes before anyone even came by our table. Once the waiter did reach our table we were greeted with a hyped up waiter who spoke so fast you couldn't understand what he was saying & he kept using douchey phrases like "chip situation", "hydration station" & so on.   We waited an additional 15 min to place our order & shortly after receiving our drinks, the food arrived. Luckily it was on point, with one exception. One of our friends ordered the small order of nachos, but got the large order & was assured she wouldn't be charged for the large order... She was.   Sparse drink refills, and persistent asking for more water was met with lackluster service & more douchey word play. The waiter nearly hit one of our friends with the water pitcher. Once or twice, it's cute & all... But this was over the top. We got a beer we didn't order, and was told it was a "gift" to go along with our other beers. I digress.   So to sum it up: the food was great as usual, but I'm not sure it's worth the wait & the poor service. We'll probably be back at some point, but likely for take out.

We just moved here from Arizona and popped in here last Saturday.  We were greeted nicely at the bar. But when my friend asked the bartender if they served tamales... And she said no, "but we have jalapeños"... We should have known better and left.  We both ordered fajitas... And for $17 per person... It was a pretty sad entree.  Plus no rice or beans or sides for that price?  Disappointing.  Decent margaritas though.

I waited over 45 minutes for a takeout order! How is this possible. First of all, I was warned it would be 20-25 minutes, which is bad enough. Then when I arrived, I had to sit and wait another 20. That's inexcusable. I could have just eaten at the restaurant and probably gotten my food sooner.
Excellent, the flavors were fantastic.  I got the chicken milanese, which i would get again next time I am here.  There is little parking, they had valet when we went.

I've been to this location three times. The two last times I went I ordered tacos. They are OK. I ordered the Pollo and the Baja Fish Taco. I just felt like they were a little lack luster. The Pollo came with chicken, avocado, pico de gallo, lettuce and chipotle crema. The Baja Fish Taco came with grilled fish, cabbage, lime, onions, and a mango sauce. I thought the mango sauce was too sweet.   The chips and salsa at the beginning of the meal were nice - again, nothing to write home about.   Service the first two times I was there was efficient and kind. Today we went for a work lunch. We had a reservation, but waited a few minutes. When we were finally seated, the chips and salsa were already on the table waiting. We were all really excited by that because we were hungry. The waitress, who was very sweet, stopped by and asked if we were ready for our drink orders. We had already looked through the menu so we were ready to order too. We all ordered from the special lunch menu. I got the Chicken Tostado Salad. Our drinks came about 5 minutes after we ordered them, I had ordered an iced tea - it never came. Then it took about 25-30 minutes to get our food. That was pretty excessive considering all the people at lunch (5 in total) ordered salads.   The salad it's self was really nice. The crunchy tortilla wasn't dredged in oil. The salad was fresh and the chicken was really well seasoned and cooked. I asked for the dressing on the side and it came on the side (you wouldn't believe how often I ask for it on the side and it comes dressed!) and the dressing was actually really good.   This is a nice option for work lunches as the location is large and room and not too loud, but considering how long it took to get food would make me consider other options for lunch if I'm in a time crunch.

We ate here on a Sunday evening and it was overall great experience.  We were seated instantly --though it wasn't busy at all, and the staffs were very efficient.  Seconds after we had been seated we were brought chips and salsa and drink orders were being taken.  The meal itself was also brought out very quickly.  I ordered their chicken fajitas and we ordered a side of con queso cheese.  The cheese was very good, though it was served a bit cold, and the fajitas were excellent.  The fajitas were served with lettuce, guacamole, tomatoes, cheese and picked onions --which were interesting but very good!  The fajitas were served on a traditional sizzling cast-iron pan and were absolutely wonderful.  That consisted of onions, peppers, chicken --the standard fajita plate.  My wife ordered a chicken burrito and was quite surprised when it was put on the table --it would have been difficult to fit this thing through the Channel Tunnel in Europe!  The burrito was gigantic --and very tasty, too!  Overall this was a great experience and we really enjoyed the food.  The service was second to none --though the restaurant was pretty slow.  I felt the food was a bit pricy; however, the service and great taste offset that and therefore I felt the price could be justified.  I cannot wait to go back!

Wonderful dinner and we could not have had a better server!!!!  We were initially seated outside and were a little uncomfortable.  Lauren F.  Was able to secure us a seat at the bar area where we enjoyed delicious fajitas and cocktails!!!!
Where is the good old Cantina 1511?! Bad location! Slow service, bad ambience.. Few years ago it was my favorite Mexican restaurant, not anymore!
Place is ok. Margaritas are good and chips are ok. You can tell this is not an authentically owned Mexican restaurant. Food is ok at best.
Mex restaurant so why Cuban music the entire time? Only good food was the chips and salsa and chicken tingas, carne asada sucked. Service slow and horrible.

Great food and service! This was our first first to the East Blvd location and we were impressed. I ordered the enchiladas de pollo and the wife ordered steak quesadillas. Both were great with bold flavor. The rice and beans were some of the best I have had; I was impressed from the first bite.   Service was friendly, quick, and knowledgeable. A new glass of Coke was dropped off every time I was halfway through the previous.   Looking forward to our next visit!

Amazing food. Spectacular service. Let me just tell you that this experience was so great that I signed up to Yelp just to write this review. Heather was our server and it was truly delightful; Carrie the manager also stopped by and was quite engaging-recommending fun things to do as we came in from out of town.  You must eat here!

Although I have only lived in Charlotte for 5 months, I have visited Cantina 1511 three times. I was initally drawn in by the promise of half priced pitchers of margaritas but the food was so incredible and the service so nice that I have returned twice just to keep sampling the vast menu.   This past week I met up with two girlfriends for some great food and a little chitchat. The chips and two kinds of salsa that appear on the table could almost sustain me for the evening but I knew there were entrees calling my name. I have celiac disease so I need to avoid gluten and sometimes that can be a problem when I eat out. However, when I asked the server to point me toward menu items made with corn tortillas she immediately asked, do you not eat gluten? I was impressed. She showed me what items are n ormally made with corn tortillas but then told me that I could order any quesadilla with corn instead of flour tortillas and said she would check with the kitchen for anything else I might be interested in. How nice!  I ended up splitting the Enchiladas de Dennis with my friend. The waitress said they were one of the most popular menu items. They were so delicious. Corn tortillas stuffed with chicken and spinach and cheeses. Yummy! We all enjoyed dinner and I cannot wait to go back and try something else.

Visited this restaurant yesterday afternoon with some out of town guests who were in the mood for a margarita.  Having eaten at this location another time and experienced bad service I was not particularly excited, but hey, how can a margarita and some nachos go wrong?    We were promptly seated and a server came to take our order.  He disappeared, we assumed to enter our drink and nacho orders.  We were very shortly visited by another server who offered to take our order.  We explained our orders had been given.  The young lady said he was in training, and she disappeared as well.  We waited a bit, and we were served chips and salsa.  The bartender noticed that a nearby table had not been served and he asked them about their order.   The table explained that we were there first and to take our order.  The bartender took our order AGAIN.   Another 10 minute wait.  I believe another server came over to ask about our order.  Finally we received our drinks and had to ask again for our nachos.  Yet another server came over and explained they were "short staffed" which was odd because over all we had at least 7 different people come over to either take our order, ask about it, or apologize.    Finally we received our nachos and additional chips and salsa.  A person told us they were very sorry for the confusion and comped the nachos, which was very nice.  This restaurant has been open for years and should operate more smoothly than this, particularly with all the other FS restaurants in Charlotte.    I hear John Hancock's shiel/spiel about this restaurant, but he must live in an alternate universe.

Ask for Dustin!  He's amazing. Great flavors nice spice. We loved the Devil's Garden mixed drink. Try the habanero salsa and the fresh guacamole. Mole is for real. Sit in the patio. Fish taco is very good and not too filling. IPA with a lime was a hit with my table. Go!  Food is great!

**I have to lower my rating on this joint...Since they've come under new owner/mgmt, they've fired some of their best staff, including Johan who brought them SO MUCH business (that won't be coming back, including me!). They've also upped their prices-granted the menu has changed, but add'l $3-$5 per entree?! Seriously?? I've been going to other spots(reviews to follow) that are less pricey and just as delicious, if not better.   I LOVE THEIR NACHOS!!! I should probably sample more of the food before writing a review, but who cares. Go for the nachos. The "appetizer" portion is enough to feed two people and have leftovers(unless you're some big ol hungryman type). Their mojitos and margeritas are the ish too.  Drinks in general are good, but catch a special, even if you have money to waste, a drink special tastes much better than regular priced booze anyday! Ask for Johan to be your server. My spicy, hot latin friend with the perfect teeth and best jiggalo accent you'll EVER here. He's awesome and the nicest guy ever. And who DOESN'T want to be served by someone beautiful that makes you think you're on vacation in S. America??(even straight guys and gay girls like me like it so ha!)
Came here while in town for a weekend trip and my experience was great. The place is beautiful, service is good and food was delicious.

I've been here a number of times, but tonight really inspired me to write a review.  A-MAZ-ING.  A friend and I visited, pretty late at night, and on a whim, decided to share one of the "family style" meals on the back flap of the menu.  We got the fish/seafood combination, which was three courses of seafood... the first was fried appetizers of shrimp, whitefish, zucchini, and calamari with delicious dipping sauces.  The second course was a paella with mussels, scallops, fish and shrimp, and dessert was a delicious tres leches cake.  WOW.  Everything was superb.  I love they offer local microbrews and the traditional Mexican favorites.  (Let's be honest, is there anything better than Negra Modelo or Dos Equis???)  I've been many times before, but can't wait to go back!

Latest visit, we were seated outside with a pretty empty dining room and sat for 20 minutes while 4 different servers ignored us. Finally walked up to a waiter we saw and said we had been ignored, waited five more minutes and just walked out. Will probably not come back for a long time.

Service was good beer was good and food was OK A nice touch is that they bring you warm chips and salsa chips tasted homemade as well as salsa Plenty of TV 's to watch games Rodger the bartender was very good Prices are good for value  Will go back
Literally only downloaded the yelp app so that I could rate them 5 stars. Best steak quesadilla I've ever had, nicest waitress, and an awesome environment. Can't wait to go back!

I love this place.  So does my wife.  Music can be a bit loud but who cares im here to eat...  My wife always get the guacamole and she loves it.  i love the queso fundido and basically anything else on the menu.  I HAVE NEVER HAD A BAD MEAL HERE.

Excellent tequila. Too bad they don't serve it the way they serve tequila in Mexico, with a shot of lemon juice and a shot of sangrita, along with the different salts. Good zucchini and cactus tacos. Great girl tending the bar!

Very disappointing for a more upscale Mexican restaurant.  It's located in park road shopping center.  There is plenty of parking available.  Chips and salsa were tasty however, the queso dip was a disappointment.  How do you mess up melted cheese.  There was absolutely nothing great about the food.  It was so disappointing I can't even remember which kind of tacos I ordered.  The rice was inedible.    It is a large restaurant with plenty of outdoor seating on the front patio.  A great view of the parking lot ;)   I will not be returning to this restaurant.  There's tons of Mexican restaurants to choose from in Charlotte and this one does not make the cut.

Great food and great prices. Authentic Mexican food and Tex Mex. This is not a run of the mill mexican joint. The soup is a meal itself. Margaritas are smooth and yum. They have an excellent happy hour menu too.

To begin with, I don't understand Cantina 1511's apparent fetish for playing Mexican music at ear-bleeding sound levels. My wife and I were in one mid-week evening after the crowd had departed and were one of only a handful of tables occupied in the entire place. We literally could not hold a conversation sitting 90 degrees from one another at a square table. When we placed our order, we also asked that the music be turned down to a moderate level, and I swear our server was overjoyed to have an excuse to turn it down.  That said, the food was OK, not great. As transplanted Californians, perhaps our standard for "great" is a little higher than someone else's, but the food was serviceable. I just don't think it justified the prices charged. The brutal truth about Mexican food is that, for the staples (enchiladas, burritos, etc), the costs are minimal, the degree of difficulty in preparation is  minuscule, the time required to plate up an order shouldn't take 20-30 minutes, and it shouldn't cost $8 to $10.  That night, the service was rather prompt but other visits we have seen very slow service. And at all times, the damn music was just obnoxious.  I'd return, but only to sit outside, and not anytime soon. To those of you who love Cantina 1511, mazel tov. I'm happy for you. I know there is a better job being done in Charlotte, though.

No hostess when I walked in. Had to wait a few minutes to be greeted. Server was good! Name was Stan in case anyone wants to request him. Guacamole was VERY GOOD! Table side presentation and very fresh. The queso dip was Meh, ok. I ordered the Salmon. The fish itself was cooked perfectly but it was very oily and needed more sauce and goat cheese.  It came with roasted tomatoes which were very oily in my opinion.  The tres leches cake is NOT like a traditional Mexican dessert. There's a marshmallow spread on top which makes it very sweet and takes over the whole dish.  Service was good and the food was ok.  I give it a 3 stars for the creamy fresh guacamole and the salmon that was cooked just right, but that's about it.

We were visiting our son from out of town and had our dog with us. Bringfido.com suggested this restaurant and we had a delightful lunch and dinner on their porch. Great service from Brian and Dawn. Very good food and dog friendly!

First of all, their chips and salsa is very good.  I am embarrassed to admit how much I actually ate.  Then came the chicken enchiladas (I forget the actual name).  They were also really good.  They came with a side of rice and beans (I just got rice because I don't like beans).  I actually wasn't a big fan of the rice, but between the enchiladas and the chips/salsa, who needs rice.

I had lunch and tried the guac, queso and enchiladas. First off for an uptown lunch, this place is a good deal. For 8.50 I got two large enchiladas packed with chicken and covered in a delicious mole. It came with a side of beans and rice, which were both good. Everything was really high quality. Guac was great and queso was delicious as was the salsa. Excellent service and a nice environment. So yeah, $8.50 for chips, salsa, and amazing enchiladas is a great deal.

This place is great. It's just a block from the Spectrum center so great for before a show or game and the atmosphere and food were top notch.  They seemed a little understaffed for the crowd but the managers kicked in to help the wait staff and kept things going. I had the pesto shrimp fajitas which were excellent!

Beware....Cantina has a new owner and new menu and it's not great.  Sigh.  My husband and I used to looove Cantina; my husband would have eaten there every day if he could.    We visited this week and found out they had a new menu.  Nothing sounded amazing.  I ordered nachos that were only so so (how can nachos only be so so?).  In addition, the service was not as good as it used to be but our waitress could have just been having a bad day.  If you've eaten at Cantina prior to July 2012 and loved it, reset your expectations so you aren't as let down as we were.    (side note, pacos tacos is still owned FS Food Group and has the same menu; phew)

So yummy! We always go here after the movies (free table side guacamole with movie stub)! I'm a fajita girl and theirs is pretty great with mushrooms and zucchini. The margarita sampler is a great value.. Three fairly large samples. I wish they hadn't gotten rid of the "Twiggy" margarita though.. Fresh lime juice and agave.. Yum!

Sunday drink special: $2.50 draft beer (4 choices: Modelo Especial, Dos Equis Amber, Fat Tire, and something else). Good start to an okay meal. Fresh made chips and salsa to begin, awesome, but salsas (verde and roja) were too salty. Ordered the table side guac appetizer because it came highly recommended by my fellow yelpers, however, I wasn't super impressed. I'm pretty sure I can make better guac for much less than $9.   My date and I were feeling slightly crazy and wanted to order the family taco plate for the two of us (8-9 tacos), but the waitress talked us down from it. We each got the 3 taco plate (lots of tacos = more variety = more accurate review of restaurant?). He got the carnitas johnny, carne asada steak, and taquitos vegetarianos. I got 3 fish tacos (damn you self-imposed pescetarianism!). Fish tacos were just okay. Lightly breaded pieces of tilapia on a bed of cabbage, topped with diced tomatoes. The saving grace was the chipotle crema and "Mexican hot sauce" (tapatio? cholula?) mixture they had going on. My favorite was the taquitos vegetarianos, lots of flavor and veggies stuffed in a not-that-crispy taco shell (which was fine with me). I was told the carne asada was just meh and the carnitas johnny was good, however, after eating those two and then having a fish taco, the fish taco tasted completely bland.   Atmosphere was conducive to date night and decor was modern. Service was just okay, I'm thinking our waitress was new because she wasn't familiar with a couple of things, but she was nice enough. Although it felt like we were being rushed through our meal from the start.   We had a few things boxed up (couldn't finish our 6 tacos, fail) and someone in the kitchen threw away the left overs before they could be boxed, but they were nice enough to make new tacos for us. Score, more tacos for later!   Overall, I would return to try other dishes, but will know to specify less salt.   My quest for a good fish taco in Charlotte continues...

This is our go-to Mexican restaurant.  The menu is a great blend of traditional and unique flavors, and is consistently good.  The made-at-your table guacamole is not to be missed, and the servers are friendly and knowledgeable about helping you make the best choice to your liking.  We have tried lunch, brunch, dinner, and catering, and have always been well pleased. This is a family-friendly establishment with both indoor and outdoor seating. There is a full bar, and margaritas to please just about any taste. Try the barbacoa and just about anything that includes avocado! Cantina 1511...yes, please!

I have been to Cantina a few times and can day I have always had a really good experience. The food is awesome, service has been great and the ambiance is pretty cool for a chain restaurant. Will defiantly come back again. The brunch is surprisingly really great, check it out!

Dinner and a show. I'm giving two stars bc the food was excellent, everything else was horrible. Our server was slow as in extremely slow and forgetful. We were seated in the lower middle portion of the restaurant, the elevate area behind us a had a large extremely loud party seated. While attempting to enjoy our meal we suddenly hear a group of females screaming only to have things escalate to the females engaging in a physical altercation. The large group was suddenly directly next to our table with everyone screaming and cursing. During this physical altercation not a single employee of Cantina 1511 bothered to address this issue. There was a server who I believed to be the server of this large group in the area laughing during the altercation. One person from this large group walked out after the altercation but not before a bit more screaming directly next to our table. The large group minus one of the females involved in the altercation sat back down still yelling and acting in a disorderly manner. There were a few tables that had recently been seated got up and walked out at this point. Servers severs were standing at the reps between the upper and middle area laughing as these tables walked out. Never once did a manager or any staff member come by and apologize for the scene. Nor did they bother to address this extremely loud large group at anytime. Bc our meal was ruined by this large loud group we decided to stop eating and take our food home. We as well as the table next to us waited a good while for our server to appear to request to go boxes. We finally get our to go boxes only to wait another 10 minutes for him to resurface to request our check. It's possible this server is new and if that's the case same on Cantina 1511 for doing a better job of training. It's really too bad these events transpired tonight as we'd been planning to dine here for several months as we'd been given rave reviews of the food. The food based on our few bites so far has been fantastic. I totally understand Cantina 1511 isn't at fault for the behavior of their guest, what they are at fault for is 1) not requesting this group to leave the resturant, especially after they continued to be so loud other diners walked out. 2) for addressing this altercation with each individual table in the same area as the altercation. It's doubtful we will return to dine again bc of the above reasons.
