I've actually been to the one on Rea Road, which doesn't seem to be listed on Yelp.  I remember this restaurant because the food was amazing! The server was extremely helpful with what he recommended, because I ordered exactly both recommendations for the appetizer and entree. They were both great. The appetizer was the Queso Fundido I think, which looked like a small pizza. Very cheesy. The entree was Barbacoa del Puerco, which was awesome. It came with tortillas where I could wrap shredded pork with other toppings such as beans, guacamole, rice, pico de gallo, cheeses, and lettuce.  YUM YUM YUM. Service was also excellent.

I went here for a girls night out. I was pretty surprised at how expensive it is. $15 for 3 tacos?!? Which might have been acceptable if the tacos had been exceptional. They were rather Bland and not very interesting at all. Big disappointment.

I'm not one to usually write a review, but in this case I must.  I'm a chef here in Charlotte and if this happened at my restaurant I'd go absolutely nuts.  We came here on July 4th as we were going to the movies in the same center.  First we had to wait 10 minutes to be sat.  Now this would not be a problem had it not been for the fact there where only 5 tables in there.  There were almost as many servers as customers so you kinda see my point here.  The person who said he was our server was to busy so someone else came to get our drink order. Again waited 10 minutes for them,. Next we placed our order and waited 20 minutes for our food.  Not unreasonable,but considering the amount of people there, kinda surprised.  My girlfriend is a little picky about thinks so when we go to a Mexican restaurant she always has the same thing, two cheese enchiladas with diced onion on top. I know everyone has there own version of things, and they claim to be authentic Mexican food, but NOT EVEN CLOSE.  The enchilada sauce looked and tasted like it was tomato based. It had similar flavors of enchilada sauce but that's were it stopped.  I had the steak chimichanga and it was a lot of fat on the steak.  At least for my taste.  When the manager came by to see why she didn't like it, he was very defensive and almost seemed rude about claiming, this is how we do it.  Well I get that but then how can you say your authentic Mexican if you do it your way.  In short I don't recommend this place and we will never come back.  It's a shame this doesn't have negative stars on it

Not realizing that you cna make reservations we walked in and they said it was a 1hr 20 min wait so we sat at the bar which took less than 5 mins to find an empty table. If you go be sure to make a reservation or call ahead. I ordered the shredded pork dish and the other person ordered the shrimp taco. Both dishes were good and a lot, I ate maybe 1/2 of mine and so did the person I was with. The prices are good for the amount of food you get. It's the drinks that are pricey! We had ordered 2 of the margarita flight specials which we only liked 1 of the 3. I agree with Brett R.'s review, for $15 you're better off getting a full drink.

I am NOT an expert on Mexican food but here is what I love about this Cantina:  really homey dining area (with a pope table for parties!!), great deck to enjoy your food while overlooking East Blvd, fantastic quac and great portion sizes.  The quacamole here is second only to Loco Lime.  Always fresh and plentiful.  They make it right at your table and to fit your palate.  Excellent accompaniment to a Dos Equis lager.  I have had the steak fajitas, soft shell tacos, chopped salad...all excellent and reasonably priced!  The valet is the best option for parking since it gets jammed there on summer nights.  Love you Cantina!  :-D

I have to say that I don't know much about Mexican food but I loooove Cantina! Only recently has their quac been pushed aside for the Number One position by Loco Lime. But it is still top notch. The fish taco appetizer is more than enough food for dinner! Great serving sizes no matter what you get. You can definitely split the fajitas since a single order is ginormous. The staff here is always super pleasant and helpful. I have been both to the Rea Road location and East and have to say quality and atmosphere and staff-friendliness is consistently excellent! Love the patio on East blvd location during the summer :-D

Chips and salsa were top notch! I absolutely love when waiters refill my chip bowl crazy quickly and here they sure did. The salsa was perfect. Not too hot but not too mild either.   The tacos were just alright. I honestly feel like I could have made better at my house. The chicken wasn't super flavorful but cooked right so I can't complain too much.   They also serve cheerwine which I have come to love in this part of the country!   I don't think I'll go back, but if you go here I don't think you will leave terribly upset. Decent Mexican.
I enjoyed my visit at Cantina very much! Rachel was very pleasant! Great customer service.
I've been here many times over the past 5 years and have never had a bad meal. Service is always spot on. Great queso

Steak fajitas as usual...but to go. I would recommend letting them know your tortilla preference and also to place the cheese in a container by itself. The Mexican rice was not that good; I would rather have regular white rice to go with my beans. There's curb side parking for to go orders which works out well when you don't want to park that far away. Overall the good was very tasty!

Ive been to 1511 a few times before and had much better experiences. I will say that the service was fine, the guacamole is awesome as everyone says. I still hate paying 10 bucks for guac knowing the ingredients cost nearly nothing but hey what are you going to do?   My gripe on this trip comes in the form of a steak chimichanga. I love chimichangas and I had never had one from 1511, so I ventured to my comfort meal. What came to me was more like a burrito the size of a football. It was not fried, which is why I am calling it a burrito. When I cut into it all I saw was rice, corn and......peas? YES PEAS. There was hardly any steak in my chimichanga. I was very upset, so I only ate half then brought the rest home hoping it would be better the next day in the fridge. That was not the case.   I will be back to 1511, the gf and myself have enjoyed it many times but I will NEVER order from the tex-mex side again.

GREAT guacamole. We are guacamole snobs but this was some of the best I have ever had. Made table side. Margaritas not that great. Hot sauce was pretty good after we doctored it up with some Texas Pete hotter sauce. We like things spicy. We both ordered tacos. They have specialty tacos. I ordered the Thailand spicy shrimp and al pastor. You can mix and match. Very delicious.  I would highly recommend this restaurant.

I gave this place 4 start for their guacamole alone.  they make it to order at your table - Delicious!  The place is usually busy for lunch or dinner. The food is the americanized mexican but has some things  you would not expect.  Overall the food is prepared very well.  I have had the filet mignon tacos, grilled pork loin, tacos and burritos.    The place has a great bar and serves up some nice drinks.  It is a good place to meet friends and I have been with several large parties and the services has been spot on.

Definitely overpriced for what it is.  I've eaten here a few times and the first couple were pretty delicious (LOVING that queso fundido) but the last time was so salty, I couldn't even eat. I sucked down tea like I'd never had a drink in my life just trying to put some moisture back into my tongue. With the over-salting and the high prices, I'd much rather go to another Mexican restaurant where it feels more authentic and rich, and where the food seems more genuine and tastes tons better.  Just wish I could take that queso fundido with me...  I will also say that if you happen to wander in late (a big no-no for me, but sometimes things happen) they won't turn you away and they serve you with the same courteous and friendly behavior as if it were the middle of the day. So kudos for that.
Always love going to cantina for a great meal at a great price. Guacamole is the best and the quesadillas.
We actually had catering from this place, but it was great! Suiza enchiladas, black beans, rice, yum. Good stuff.

Food was really good.   I had the Big Burrito with Chicken and it was done really well.  The only drawback was the service.  Came during lunch and it just seemed lacking.  I eat out a lot and a little bit goes along way with me.

We came here on a Saturday night in hopes of giving this place another try. The first time had to of been 10 years ago and it was awful. I made a reservation thinking it would be packed (wasn't). Our waiter was pretty impatient and wouldn't stick around to hear 3 people order. He showed us the drink menu but kept walking away before we could order. He snapped at my mom when she asked for a regular margarita instead of telling him the name of the one she wanted. He asked her to refer to the menu that he previously showed her. It was pretty rude and awkward. Her margarita ended up being straight sour mix and it the worst drink I've ever seen prepared (just graduated college and those bars make a better marg).... We kept getting baskets of chips that were only crumbs, which was frustrating. When we got our food it was a lot. The ingredients seemed fresh and well prepared. I wouldn't say it was anything special though. The price is pretty high for what it is. I probably wouldn't go back and from the looks of it they probably won't be there much longer. Next door had a lot more business. Poor service, expensive food. Do not recommend
The guacamole is delicious. Also the guacamole is delicious. I don't know if I've mentioned it but the guacamole is delicious.

Great, fresh Mexican food! I would highly recommend getting the guacamole. They make it fresh at the table and it was very good. Their tacos are the perfect size and everything we tried was great. Our waitress worked really hard to provide good service even though she was very busy.
The Carna Asada burrito is out of this world! One of my favorite places and things to eat in Charlotte. Their house margarita is also good!

This is a good place for a dinner date.  Cantina 1511 boasts a great atmosphere, eye-catching decor, and romantic lighting.  The menu is split into two sections: authentic Mexican dishes on one side and the Americanized entrees we're all used to on the other.  Their specialty is handmade guacamole made tableside with a mortar and pestle.  I usually avoid guacamole like the plague (mostly because of the appearance, if I'm honest) but I gotta admit, this stuff was very tasty!  If you're looking for a unique Mexican dining experience, give Cantina 1511 a visit!

We've eaten there many times. Just had lunch there on Saturday. Sat outside. We decided to have Margaritas and a couple of us tried a Drag N Berry. Margaritas were very good. The Drag N Berry was very syrupy/heavy but had good flavors and was heavy on the alcohol. Would have rather had homemade lemonade with a shot of something but they were out of lemonade. Love their taco selection - great combinations. I had a puerco al pastor, that had pork and pineapple (yum) and another that was brisket cooked in red sauce. They have a couple of good Mexican beers on tap, and had $3 blue moons as the special. We had a very nice relaxed meal with an attentive waiter. Try it you'll like it!!
It was above average which is always nice. I don't say this often but I would go again. The taste of the food was on point and were it needed to be.

Boy do I miss moms real authenic cooking now! The Cantina Chimichanga should have been taken home. It was too big and my dog was hungry.   Oh well I guess I will keep looking for the best place to have Mexican Food in Charlotte.

Went for lunch with 2 co-workers...food was excellent once again.  Lunch portions are sized really well.  I had the fish tacos lunch portion and was very satisfied with the amount of food.    Our server, Adrian, was very knowledgable and made some excellent suggestions on meal choices that proved to be on point.  Food came out well prepared and in a timely manner.    I would recommend anyone go there for lunch ASAP!

First time at Cantina Stonecrest. NOT GOOD. I ordered a chicken quesadilla and asked for shredded chicken. Waiter said they don't have shredded chicken. Ok what???? How do you not have shredded chicken? You just shred the chicken....I'm not sure what the disconnect was. Waiter brought out my plate...no shredded chicken and no conversation about it. I made a smart comment and the waiter didn't say a word. We also had two people there celebrating birthdays....one of our guests asked when we got there to have someone come to sing happy birthday for two of our guests...never happened.   This place sucks, food sucked and WAY overpriced. The quesadilla that I got at Cantina was $14.95....it costs $5-6 at other mexican places and tastes so much better.   Will not return

My husband and I just moved to Charlotte and were looking for a new favorite Mexican Restaurant. This was not it. There was no al a cart menu and no chicken mole (two things we like to order/ off of.) While the prices were steep the food was ok. They were completely out of there house margarita by 7 pm which sucks Bc that's my favorite kind of drink and I hadn't anticipated the price of what they did have available (they still are not serving half their drink menu understandable they just opened.)  The staff was friendly but I was waiting for my drink to be refilled a couple times (not so good when your eating spicy food). The place was good but not for the price or the wait. I think my brother was right, the best Mexican restaurant is a shady one.
Terrific food here with our server Alicia tonight.  Always a pleasant place to come!  Great service!

Service was horrible.  We walked in and the hostess was talking to two men in the bar area.  There isn't much of a waiting area and there were four of us so we steppedmout ofmthe way. A couple came into the restaurant and walked to the podium...the waitress seated them right away, before even talking to us!  We waited about 15 minutes to get a seat...and then were seated in the bar area.  My husband ordered a beer.  They didn't have it.  He selected a second beer.  They didn't have that one eother.  The food was pretty good.  But when the bill came, we were charged for the beer!  For the price of the food the service should be better.  I was shocked when the bill came.
Good ambiance..my fav place for mexican food. Awesome Margaritas!

ROCKING guac they make at your table - so fresh. Waiter recommended a lighter, white con queso which was a $1 side - perfect. Caesar salad was delicious too. Marg flight was ok. In general a little too much sour mix but the blood orange math was the best for sure. Nice staff and overall I'd recommend --

Great supreme nachos!  I was impressed with the amount of meat and things they piled on the nachos most places skimp on the toppings they don't. For my entree  I ordered the Mexican Pork BBQ which was solid nothing amazing but good.  I didn't eat alot of it because I was so full from the nachos.  You get all you can eat nachos and salsa with your meal.
My favorite is the El pastor and shrimp poboy tacos..  The guacamole is alway made with love and there salsa is great kick

Don't love the new location and service is not as good as it once was.  Still good food, but it has a cheaper strip mall feel to it which keeps me from wanting to go.  I might make this a strictly take-out destination from here on out.

My first visit came here over the weekend.  I liked it....you underwhelmed with that statement?  Well, that's kinda how I felt about Cantina.  I like it, I really do but maybe my taste buds and palette isn't distinguished enough to discern between Mexican meals.  What I mean is, yeah it was fine and the fresh and all things good but I didn't come away from the place thinking OMG, I can't wait to get back.  One thing I will say is that I really like the upscale (compared to most Mexican joints) interiors.  So if I want to step it up a couple notches from some place like an Azteca, I'll visit Cantina.  But if I'm looking to just get down and grub on some Mexican cuisine I'd probably stick to the Azteca type faire.

Stopped in here for dinner and drinks with friends last night.  Upon entering the place I noticed the look and feel is almost identical to that of the one off East Blvd.  Not a bad thing.  Large bar area to the left was open and inviting and the service from the moment we stepped in was great.  I was a little off put by the fact that this night they had run out of steak and scallops but I suppose these things happen from time to time.  I got a Southwestern salad with chicken and wasn't dissapointed.  Also the gauc was very good, although at $9.50 a bit pricey.  Parking is a little crazy in Stonecrest as you might already know so be prepared to walk after parking.

Best Mexican food with authentic flavors here in Charlotte. I have ate here a few times now and I have to let everyone know how good this place is. Besides the food the margaritas are hands down made to perfection with a good selection to choose from even the specialty cocktails. Salsa nights are awesome on Saturday nights with free parking with validation.

We always leave Cantina happier than we arrived. We've sat at the bar for apps and margaritas or dinner on the patio. Tonight we had dinner in the dining room. The tostada appetizer was to die. I had the veggie enchiladas and my fiancé had a beef burrito. Delicious! Lucky for us we each had leftovers which we'll devour for lunch tomorrow.

This place is the worst. Service is terrible. We sat at the bar for 20 minutes with no service. They were busy and the bartender was slammed. However, the manager walked the bar 3 times and didn't even ask if we needed drinks or wanted to order. Nothing! It's a joke.    This chips are always stale and the service ALWAYS STINKS!  Great location, great job on the up-fitting of the building but not ever stepping foot in this place.  Every time I give them another shot I'm disappointed!   Big let down.  Wish they were back on east when Eric worked the bar and Patrick was the manager. I went there like 3 times a week and ALways had excellent service regardless of how busy they were!

Always enjoyed the food there and the service was great when it first opened. Unfortunately the lunch staff they have now cannot handle large parties. I waited tables and bar tended for years so i have patience and understand how demanding people can be when they have separate checks and want to get in and out , it can be quite frustrating. However we have a reservation for 10 it took 15 mins for them to seat us ( table was ready it wasn't that busy) it took another 20 Minutes to get waters . I said to the server "feel free to take our orders whenever " her response "you'll have to wait a minute" .. ok fine maybe she's busy .. 15 mins later she asks if we know what we want, by this time everyone has to order there food to go. She could have cared less she didn't even seem busy she was puttering around leaving a cake at a table she had already served and filling water. What could have made her money probably only made her $2 a person and i have never left less than $5 on anything no matter how small. I won't leave her name but her attitude sucked and i hope she's a little more in her game if she ever works a night shift. By cold food was sub par by the time i got back to the office. That's 15 people that won't me back and i used to really like that place . Oh well there are many more choices in the area.
Great house margaritas and excellent guacamole!

Love their staff and specially their AMAZING QUESO! I could literally eat their tortillas and queso all day! We came in a few weeks back after the snow storm left us to walk to get food. As a younger couple, we didn't think to buy food in advance. Lol! Upon entering we were given a warm welcome and were served by an awesome guy! I want to say his name was hunter? Or Charles? He was an awesome server and gave us exceptional service! We were very happy when we walked home with full bellies and to go plates full of more chips and left overs! Thanks Hunter/Charles for being so nice to us! :)

I love Cantina 1511!!!!  It is that plain and simple.    The margaritas are fantastic and fresh!  And the table-side made-to-order guacamole is AMAZING!  I could eat that and have a margarita and be done for the day.  Service is great and the atmosphere is very relaxing and inviting.    I say it's a definite "Must-try"!
Maybe they were having an off night? Chips were not that great and the sauce on the enchiladas verdes was very different tasting. Love their guacamole though so I would give them another shot.

If  I wasn't obsessed with some of their food, I would have given up before now... But let's recount my last four visit- 1 Called in carry out - discovered at home food was wrong  2 Called in carry out - discovered at home food  was wrong. Called in and they remade food, requiring me to make trip back to restaurant.  3 Dined in - took nearly 40 minutes to get our food.  4 Called in carry out - again food was wrong. Caught it while I was there. I had to wait to get food remade. Kinda defeats the point of calling in an order.

I just ordered $25 worth of food for myself ($10 of it was queso). This is America--where we have the right to get chips with our queso. BUT apparently Cantina 1511 thinks otherwise. When I called to inquire about this absurd monstrosity of an issue, not only did the woman hang up on me without letting me speak to the manager, I now have no chips in which to enjoy this queso. Way to go, Cantina! I hope this review loses you many more customers seeing as your customer service skills suck.  P.S. Management needs to get a grip on what's happening in that place. First the menus show two different prices for the food and now this.  Rude.

The Good: - The 5-cheese appetizer was delicious. - Our server refilled out water and sweet teas without prompting. - The food arrived quickly.  The Bad: - The Chimichanga had corn inside (it wasn't listed on the menu). - The soup one party member ordered was not delivered as an appetizer as requested, but instead was delivered with the rest of the entrees. - The prices recently went up (December, 2014) which means that two taco's now cost $12 (previously, they were $10). That 20% price increase is seen across the menu.

This place is in park road shopping center. You can get a good parking space since there are several available. The staff are friendly and welcoming. The drinks here need some work. In coming here I stuck to the shots or basics that you know. If you steer away from known territory you will get your feelings and pockets hurt for wasting money. The baja taco has flavor and the chicken taco needs seasoning. Whether you have the nacho app ( I recommend) or the tacos it's good portions. The decor is fun vibrant and lively. They don't have regular events but they could look into that to liven the place up. Happy eating.

Was so hoping I would like this place.  Guacamole was delicious. Chips were thin and salty and delicious.   Shrimp taco w peanut glaze was delicious as was calamari taco.   Now the bad.  Waited 15 minutes for our beers to be brought to table. Our service was just not timely at alllllllllll.  My chicken burrito was all rice. If there was chicken it was not obvious at all  very disappointed. Burrito gets a 2.    Would not go back
Awful. Bland flavored food. One member of our party had hair in her food. GROSS!!! Service didn't come with a smile. The manager who came over to apologize was nice. I will never go back.

This place was solid but not spectacular.  The menu is limited and combines some really weird things together.   However, the combinations turned out to be delicious .   The service was also very solid and far better than I am used to elsewhere.  I only have it 4 stars because of the menu options.  It took my girlfriend and I like 25 minutes to make a decision on what to order.   I would give this place a solid B+ and we would certainly consider it among our options in the future
One of our favorite spots! Picked up lunch for the office yesterday. Chimichangas, nachos, enchiladas, fish tacos, fajitas and fresh guacamole!! Yumola! Thanks Cantina!! You made our day.
Very yummy queso dip!!! Fish taco were also very delicious. Service could have been better. Overall two thumbs up!

Viva Mexico!  start out with the customary and complimentary chips and salsa, I lovvee that the salsa has a nice kick to it!  Score 1!  ordered chicken and 1 Marco Polo shrimp tacos but these are definitely not your average.  The shrimps are a nice size and seasoned well, the toppings taste very fresh, crunchy bacon, jalapeno, some delicious aioli sauce, say it with me YUM!.  The Ancho Pollo chicken taco wasn't too shabby either.  The taco comes with one side, I like the rice and black beans which comes in a small cup.  For libations, I ordered the Orange Tijuana Taxi, yes, yes and yes to this cocktail!  Finished off with the banging tres leche cake, notice I didn't say slice because the cake is enough to be shared with 3 ppl and it was delicious.  Parking is valet so need to worry about looking for a spot when you get here.  Just bring your appetite and enjoy

This is the first time I've been to the park rd location as the Ballantyne location is closer to me. The atmosphere at Park road is by far better than Ballantyne but that's about it.   We had a large party, and since they didn't take reservations until after 830 we pushed back when we were planning on eating until 830 to ensure seats and good service with such a large group. This was not the case.  At least we had a table right away but the service was terrible.  It took almost 30 minutes after our drink orders were placed for our first drinks to arrive.  They were just passed down the table for us to pick which one we thought we ordered.   After being there for an hour we had to flag down the waitress to ask if we could order food, she said she was waiting for us to get settled. We'd been there for an hour. We were settled.  Food was good per usual (except they "ran out" of the one thing I wanted), and came out in a decently timely manner especially compared to the speed of the drinks. Waters weren't refilled unless asked, and never once were we checked on unless we flagged down the waitress.  I'm a pretty patient person and I understand we were a big party and things get busy. But the rest of the restaurant was pretty empty (especially after an hour into being there), there were tons of empty tables, and plenty of other employees standing around literally doing nothing, or giving back rubs to each other standing behind our table.  I felt like someone should have stepped in to help out since there were plenty of people around to do it.   Food, drinks, and company were good.  I think I'll stick to the Ballantyne location from now on!
Did a family style dinner for a wedding rehearsal. Not well designed but had a good time. Wait staff seemed a bit over whelmed. Will need to try a regular dinner to judge better.

Last week was my second visit to Cantina 1511. This time I sat at the bar and the experience was particularly good. I was quickly greeted by one of the bartenders who offered water and the wine list. I then had a pleasant time drinking some Chardonnay and eating some chips and salsa while perusing the menu. My goal was to eventually take out my dinner so my goal was to determine what would travel well. The two bartenders "tag-teamed" and so I was well taken care of. When asked about the different between the tortilla soup and the pozole verde the bartender offered me a sample of the soup. Nice. I chose the tortilla soup and a "small" chopped salad (was plenty.) I'll have to say that the tortilla soup is exceptionally good plus they packed the tortilla strips and cheese in a separate container so I could add them when I got home.  Well done Cantina 1511.

Had quite a poor experience at this newest location over the weekend.  We stopped in after church on Sunday to grab lunch before a show, should have had plenty of time.  There were only around four seated tables in the place, yet it still took 10 minutes for us to be seated.  The service was passable, but 35 minutes after we ordered we still had no food.  The waitress eventually came over, apologized, and told us the kitchen was short staffed, and to expect our food in five minutes.  Ten minutes later, and sans lunch, I went to the bar and asked to speak to the manager.  The bartender told me the manager was in the kitchen and went back to what he was doing, so I again asked to speak to the manager.  He actually sneered at me in response, and then huffed off to get her.  In her defense, she handled it well.  She owned up to the fact she had no real excuse, the restaurant wasn't functioning up to par, and she was doing what she could.  She was clearly flustered and doing her best, but I got the impression that the staff was not exactly up to the task of handling the now seven seated tables in the place.  She comped our meal without me asking and apologized profusely.  I couldn't have asked her to do more, but it is a bit disappointing that a restaurant with 3 local locations cannot staff their newest offering with staff that knows how to provide solid service.  By the time our food arrived, we had to bolt it down to make the theater.   As I told her- they are lucky I know and like the concept, otherwise I'd have not considered returning.  Hope this place gets it's act together.  I'll consider giving them another shot under the right circumstances, but it's in a place with a ton of other good choices so it's not like I'll be seeking them out.
Margs were great. Service was not. Will give it another try once they work the kinks out

Normally this restaurant is fine - good food, good customer service, etc. No complaints. However, after last night, I am NEVER eating at Cantina 1511 ever again. Consider this review a public service announcement: do not go to this restaurant if you a) have any nut allergies or b) care about customer service at all.  Last night my friend, who is very allergic to nuts, went to Cantina for dinner and ordered the enchiladas. She ate her entire meal before realizing she didn't feel well. Her throat started itching and her lips swelled up as if she were having an allergic reaction. She called the waiter over and asked if the enchiladas contained nuts and the waiter said he didn't think so, he thought the only dishes with nuts were the desserts, but he would ask the chef to be sure. After asking the chef, the waiter informed my friend that the only dishes with nuts were indeed the desserts and a couple of salads, but that both were prepared on the opposite side of the kitchen from where her dish was prepared. My friend was fairly certain she was having an allergic reaction, though, so the manager was called over. The manager then told her that the enchilada sauce contains nuts and that it was her responsibility to ask if the dish has nuts. That is simply ridiculous. What Mexican dish has nuts?? And if one does, it should be stated on the menu! Also, even if my friend had asked the waiter if the dish contained nuts, neither he nor the chef would have known the answer! Lastly, all else aside, the customer is always right. It is absurd for the management to blame my friend for something that was definitely the restaurant's fault. The situation could have been exponentially worse and Cantina could have faced a serious lawsuit. I am thoroughly disappointed with the way management handled this situation (he made her pay for the meal and basically berated her experience) and it goes without saying that I will never return to Cantina 1511.     UPDATED: An employee from Cantina responded to this review and was extremely courteous and apologetic. He expressed genuine concern and assured me that management would be notified. He also promised this would never happen again. While I hate the situation happened, I am thoroughly grateful for the restaurant's response. Thank you Cantina!! Maybe I'll be back after all :)
Service is great and staff really helps you pick the right entree .. love it  If you can ask for Chris please do. She was amazing!
Yeah... No....  the only good thing about it were drinks. Mexican food? I don't think so.

Great food and great service! We ordered the Enchiladas Verde and the Fish tacos.Both were very good.  We started with the complimentary chips and salsa, and the salsa was very fresh and delicious. We will definitely be back.
First time here and I'll be back! I loved my salmon salad. The guacamole with bacon was everything, made right at your table.

Excellent, just plain excellent.  Showed up with reservations with a large group (8) on a Thursday night.  We were on a mission that night and had been sampling food all over Charlotte, and Cantina was the last stop.  We ordered the tableside Guacamole which was to die for.  Our server whipped it right up and it tasted perfect.  One thing however, we ordered 2 tableside guacamole's and they only prepared 1 tableside.  The other was just brought to us from the kitchen.  Not sure what's up with that.  The Barbacoa was a crowd favorite, I have had this at the other location and it has been on point every time.  Duck Taco's, again a work of art.  3 on a plate and they did not disappoint.  I would highly recommend any of these dishes.  Cantina is Tex Mex at it's finest.  Great location, great service, great food......roll credits.

To be fair, I wrote an e-mail to the General Manager first, and he didn't respond after over a week so here's my update.  Went for lunch a week and a half ago, it was for my daughters birthday lunch and she loves Cantina 1511 as does my whole family.    The restaurant had a large number of flies, so much so that they impeded my families enjoyment of their lunch.  The flies were pretty bad during the chips and salsa stage but got worse when the meal arrived.  They asked to be moved and they were accommodated.  Once they moved a Manager (female) came over and offered a lame explanation about it being summer and flies are to be expected.      They finally left after paying for their meal which couldn't be eaten because they were pretty disgusted because of the fly issue.  It was a slow lunch day and not many people were in the restaurant.  They left after splitting the bill with the other party, the bill was around $60.00 ($28.22 which was half the bill).     Normally we like the restaurant and my wife who isn't a complainer her opinion is that she doesn't want to go back, which, I'm sure isn't what they want to hear  My kids didn't want to eat the food they boxed up and brought home because of the memories of the flies.  My wife has worked in restaurants for many years and I am in the commercial food industry, and we know there are sprays out there that can eliminate flies.  The managers explanation simply doesn't cut it and it sounds like she needs some retraining on how to respond to customer issues.

I LOVE CANTINA 1511. I could shout it from the hilltops, like Julie Andrews in the Sound of Music. Seriously, folks do-re-mi favorite restaurant in Charlotte, hands down.  The decor is Mexi-sexy, with low lighting, booths and tables both, and a great outdoor patio. The bar area is small, but cozy and always well stocked with local and imported beers.  The service = outstanding. Over the years I've been going, I have never had anything less than stellar service. I am one who is a stickler for good service (great food can be made OK when the waiter is a jerk), and this place gets 6 stars in that department.  Foodwise, I've never had anything that didn't make me say "Oh my god, try this!" to whoever my lucky date was. A good mix of texmex and authentic, I oftentimes get the 3 tacos with rice and beans. Now I am not ussually a taco person, but their taco options make it near impossible to resist: a chicken taco with pineapple salsa, taco al pastor with pork and greenchiles/habeneros salsa, a vegetarian hard taco smothered in red sauce with a medely of perfectly cooked vegetables inside that makes you wonder why you ever need to eat meat again, and a carne asada taco with onions that is so good you want to high five a cow.   Other hits include the pork entree (slow cooked in spices, falls off the bone, right into my mouth, mmmm), salmon (best salmon of MY LIFE), and the Nutella pie dessert. That dessert.... just try it. It will be one of the best decisions of your life besides having sex, getting married, having kids and buying that winning lotterry ticket.   Can you tell I love this place? If you're looking to go out with friends, a date, your mom or your parole officier, look no further. Cantina has something for everyone, with unmatched quality and superior service.
Great service. Really friendly staff. Food is usually great. Great guacamole. Food came out really fast and very kid friendly!

Wow. What a sad situation. We came here once before and had such great service. Sadly we chose to come back today and decided to sit at the bar. 3 pm on a Saturday and there are a total of 8 people at the bar.   Service is atrocious. The woman behind the bar could not be bothered to serve the clients as she was too busy ignoring us and cleaning glassware. We ordered the guacamole at $9 a pop and had to ask repeatedly for chips. Our beer glasses were empty for 10 minutes and she finally asked if we wanted more beer. By now I only want water and my damn check. Too bad cuz I thought I found a great local place to go. Better keep looking.

This is my favorite place for Mexican in the city. I'm so glad they moved into their Park Rd. location because parking is so much easier. My only suggestion would be to make a reservation if you're going at a popular time. My favorite dishes are the chimichangas, enchiladas and their fish tacos. LOVE the salsa!

Incredible!! Took some visiting family there last weekend and had a fantastic experience! The food and the service was outstanding! I had the chicken torta (sandwich), family had the chimichanga and we also had the guacamole they make at the table. Everything was simply fantastic!

I wanted to like this place more, but it lacks the casual, laid-back atmosphere of most Tex-Mex joints, and the food doesn't warrant the higher price tab. We took our kids and I felt a little out of place in the slightly upscale setting. Might be nice for a date night, though. The tacos were terrific and margaritas first-rate, but you can enjoy pretty much the same meal at Paco's Tacos or Maverick Rock for a good bit less.

Food is good but service way too slow. Ordered queso and guacamole, and waited for at least half an hour. Entrée took even more time, no wonder. Besides the slow service, food is good and comes in large portion. I ordered the three tacos for $15 combo. Each one was large. Their refried beans are really good, strongly recommend.
Taco Bell is better. Taco fell apart. Had to eat without shell. No seasoning on beans and rice. Would not recommend
Great way to spend a Monday evening. Free comedy show. Good food, kind service and nice crowd. Highly recommend!

I've been here on two separate occasions and I can say that I'm pleased with the food for the most part the service is blah just because they are usually pretty busy but the food is great I love the pork tacos they're street corn is great.

Overall the place, was pretty good! I had ordered the steak and chicken fajitas, which were very delicious! The steak was cooked just the way I had asked for, which I appreciated a ton! My margarita was also very tasty, my boyfriend asked for spicy margarita, which they don't have on the menu but they made anyways for him so that was a plus! My only complaint about the restaurant was the server was very slow when it came to bringing over check, she disappeared for probably 15/20 minutes, and it seemed like it was her first time serving.. Other than that I truly enjoyed the Cantina and would recommend for the food and margaritas!!

Wow...what a difference can make after a few visits.    My GF and I were dying for some frozen margaritas and 1511 came to mind..we don't go anywhere else, but their machine broken down a few weeks ago, so we waited till it got replaced.  We arrived very early on Friday and was seated outside and proceeded to order drinks...this time it was just going to be drinks.  So the first order arrives and my GF finds a tiny Ant in her drink...very easy to do as the drink itself it practically white.  My drink is okay..  The next rounds she finds ANOTHER SMALL Ant...we still don't say anything, but this time I search my drink and what do you know...I TOO have a small Ant in mine.  We tell the server, which takes the drink back and replaces it.  Just for giggles I search again in my new drink...another one shows up?  By now the server is frustrated and replaces the drink again.   The manager also comes out and apologized, but we tell them there must be a bunch that got into the machine when they got it.  The bartender asks the server if we have Ants on the table..........THAT FOLKS is the first warning signs of trouble for a customer....They aren't worried if we are upset...but whether we are making it up or trying to rip them off???????  Now we have 1 more round, plus I have another...we find one more Ant...a total of 7 drinks and 4 of those had Ants.  (a photo is included of one of the little rascals)  We aren't upset, just feel bad for the server and barstaff, but when the bill comes, only 2 drinks are written off????/  I mean really, you would have thought the top end mexican restaurant would have been all over this as it is a health code problem...but no, they just wrote off a sub set and sent us on our way.....hmmm....well off with 2 stars for that one.  Not that we wanted a free ticket, but I really felt like management dropped the ball.    Can you imagine for a moment if the guy from "Hells Kitchen" had been part of that event.....what hell he would have raised at the manager and servers....how much grief and swearing he would have done to those folks for acting they way they did...really, seriously...they need a wake up call..........OR......this is bigger problem than customers realize, hence the lack of concern?????????????  Hmmmm....something to think about when you are thinking about dining or drinking with these folks.

This placed moved from Dliworth to Park Rd and I'm not sure what happened in the process but it is not the same restaurant it once was. Everything we ordered was average. Honestly, if I didn't know better I would think I was at On the Border. It was like I was eating Mexican cafeteria food. Try Bakersfield or Sabore if you're wanting a South of the Border vibe. Babalu is pretty good too. Cantina needs to step it back up.

Was pretty good I thought. This is a slightly more upscale Mexican place so they fancy things up a bit and charge more for it. The chicken enchiladas with a creamy sauce on them I had were good and reasonably priced. The beans were good, rice sorta blah. I also had a  Los 1511 Margarita which was very good and had lots of fresh lime but it was not $12 good in a 10 ounce glass. To start with I had the table side made guacamole which was excellent and a decent serving size. I would go here again.

Totally amazed by Cantina 1511. Not just with the food (which is always delicious) but the customer service is incredible. Yesterday we ordered fajitas to-go. Almost all the way home, we received a call from them telling us they had forgotten to give us the fajita wraps. Being rush hour, we decided to just stop by the grocery store rather than drive all the way back. Instead, they insisted on driving to our house and bringing us the wraps!! Who does that?? That's incredible. Not only did we get our wraps but a free dessert as well. Top notch service.  Thank you guys at East Blvd. Cantina and thank you Ally who took care of this for us. We were beyond impressed.

I haven't been to the new location until today and it's beautiful. The bar has two huge tvs and very comfortable stools. It's surrounded by a ton of high top tables half of which have those same comfortable stools. Have I mentioned how comfortable they are yet?  The service was impeccable. Drinks remained full as did the chips and salsa. The cheese dip is amazing and came out piping hot on with a candle to keep it that way. Our meals came out in the perfect amount of time to allow us to enjoy our appetizer. Our waitress was very attentive and never made us feel rushed.  If your in the area be sure to stop in and ask for Megan. She will take very good care of you.
Great chips & salsa and the guacamole was fantastic!  Service was great and attentive.   A good experience overall.

Group fun at Cantina.... OH YEA... we got the fish bowl room!  Just be careful you don't run into the awkwardly placed glass partition.  Dinner was wicked good!  I had the veggie something or nother... Tasted fried, so I'm good!  Everyone at the table (8 or us) was pleased with everything that they ordered.  The waitress was very attentive even though our group seemed to have overwhelmed her a wee bit!  I do like this place a good bit, so if you're looking for a great lil mexican restaurant then definitely check it out.  I've never heard of anyone having a bad experience there!  Check out the Dragonberry cocktail!  It's spectacular!    Make reservations, they book up quick!

I made a reservation and walked right in and didn't have to wait. The marinated shrimp with plantains and black beans were awesome. I had cool waitress that gave me a sample of a local jalapeno beer they have on draft. I didn't like it but appreciated her offering to let me try it before I bought a full glass. The food/service is a level( or two) up from your typical Mexican restaurant (i.e Monterreys, Zapatas) Nice spot to take a date. I def.plan to return soon.

I've been here twice now and both times have been delicious. The service is awesome, the food is crazy good and the atmosphere is fun. You can sit outside where it's a little quieter, by the bar or int he dining area!   They have great salsa, warm chips, guacamole and their portion sizes are HUGE! We love this place!!  The first time I went, I ordered the chopped salad with salmon. It had mixed salad greens, jicama, red onions, garbanzo beens, cucumber, cotija cheese, cucumber, and avocado with the dressing on the side.  The salad was perfection.  The second time I went I ordered the Western Cobb salad. It had chopped romaine, cucumbers, roasted corn, black bean salsa, jalapeno bacon, hand cut tortilla strips, avocado, cotija cheese and chipotle ranch on the side. It was amazing. They don't cut you short on the chicken. I don't think I've ever finished an entire salad at a restaurant. There wasn't a drop left.

For Sunday evening dinner, while in Charlotte, we took a break from southern cooking and chili dogs and such and decided to have some Mex.  It is always a crap shoot when you go to a new city and try to pick a decent Mexican place.  We read a few reviews and decided on Cantina 1511.  Well, we've had better and we've had worse.  Starting with the salsa which was amateurish loaded with cumin "because that's what makes it Mexican" (I heard a guy say that once).  The guacamole "made" at the table is kind of like semi-made at the table.  It is a large order, made with two avocados.  But the lime juice is pre-squeezed so the fragrant oils are lost completely.  The tomato and onion and cilantro are supplied by using some premixed pico with large onion hunks.  We don't want the hunks of raw onion so asked our server to leave the pico and we picked through it to have some tomato.  We also asked for more lime to add, since they did not add enough.  He brought us more, but again, pre-squeezed.   After sorting out enough tomato from the pico and adding more lime juice and salt, we made it OK to eat.  They really need to juice the limes with the little manual juicer at the table.  Ms T had fish tacos (they were fried, not grilled) and declared that they simply had no flavor.  They were made from the ubiquitous tilapia, (which normally tastes like dirt to me) floured in masa.  These did not taste like fish or dirt or masa.  Just fried stuff.  I ordered Tacos al Pastor.  This style of meat has become popular in the US in the last couple of years and it is rarely made right.  Cantina 1511 joins that club.  I really don't expect a trompo of seasoned pork that gets cut off with a large machete and grilled to crisp it a bit, like a good gyro.  But this was shredded pork stew, sweetened, too wet.  It is not supposed to be sweet.  I have eaten in the restaurant in Mexico City that claims (who knows if true) to have invented the style.  Cantina 1511's version is not even good by US standards.  The rice was the plastic pellet style, I guess made from converted or instant rice.  The black beans were pretty cuminy, not well seasoned.  It is a very nice place.  Jamal provided excellent service.  They are trying to be modern Mexican, but are not quite getting there.  I would keep looking for Mexican in Charlotte.

You know what, giving this restaurant 5 stars says a lot coming from me (like I'm some sort of food critic). But seriously, everything from the restaurant atmosphere to the prepared-in-front-of-you guacamole, I was in love.   Oh and did I mention when we first sat down we were told there were $4 Margaritas & Mojitos....and our very attentive waiter kept em coming....SOLD!  Did I mention that they make the guacamole fresh at your table and they'll add more/less spice as you prefer...SOLD!  Did I mention that the salsas (both the regular tomato and the lime salsa, OMG) and the chips were fresh and I couldn't get enough....SOLD!  All I have left to say is Shrimp Tacos....I need a damn cigarette now I don't even smoke...EXHALE!  And I'm no local, so don't worry about me "juicing up" these Charlotte restaurants...as you'll see in another review ;-)
Great customer service.  Called to make reservation for future and told to call back another day because they are busy tonight  Manager followed up.

A little pricey but delicious!! We started off with the Street Food Platter ... so delish that right there is a meal in its self! Apparently the selections vary but I believe on that day we had the biggest calamari I have seen in my life, quesadillas, and some kind of meatballs which were pretty tasty. I had the Pan Seared Sea Scallops and Shrimp as my main course and it was delish ... but very salty. I love salt nom nom nom... but those scallops were like pretty much soaked in a vat of salt and then thrown into the pan . The shrimp was delish but the scallops thumbs down . My sister had the chicken tacos and she thought they were pretty tasty as well. We told the waiter it was my sisters birthday and he brought out a piece of a piece of the four milk cake ... obviously they didn't include chocolate milk in this cake so I didn't eat any, but my sister did she said it was alright. She may have enjoyed it more if we weren't so full off of the appetizer, margaritas and main course! Overall I really liked this place and would love to try it again!

I wish I could give them a higher rating, but this was my third time trying the restaurant and still they just don't make the grade.  To start, it does not matter what time of day I have visited or how many tables were filled, it takes a minimum of 30 minutes to get your food. I even ordered everything as soon as the waiter came to my table and still, 35 minutes later my main course was served.   The cheese enchilada dinner if served in the iron skillet which is how most of their dishes are served taste like iron. It has absorbed the flavor of the metal and definitely does not taste good. When asked to have cheese enchiladas served on a plate, the cheese was cold and the portion was significantly smaller and again, lacked in flavor and taste.  Pros - great location, great chips and salsa and good drinks.  Cons - I have yet visit and be in and out in less than 45 minutes to an hour and a half. Two of three times I have visited the waitstaff has been new, did not know the menu and did not seem to be fully trained or engaged.

Visited for a date night evening.  Original plan was to go to Firebird.  However, Firebird had a two hour wait.  So we decided to venture to Cantina 1511.  We were pleasantly surprised that we could be seated within 30 minutes.  The atmosphere was inviting and the wait staff was delightful.  I ordered fish tacos and my wife ordered quesadillas.  The nacho chips were freshly made and seasoned to perfection.  I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone and we intend to visit again very soon.

I ordered the Baja tacos and other than the Taco Bell style hard shells they were quite good. I ordered one soft and one hard and the soft was definitely better and more authentic. Our waiter Ben was excellent. Attentive but not annoying. Regular Margarita was average. Music was oldies (80's) rock the whole time and a little on the loud side. We were on the patio which was really nice for being on a parking lot. Overall good experience.
Delish Guacamole, wonderful margarita...This is a great lunch spot. I recommend Tahona Margarita is a must, it's a one and done type.

My favorite Mexican spot in town. Yes, I realize it's more of a Mexican-fusion restaurant, but stick to the authentic Mexican items and you can get a killer meal for a reasonable price. Their chips and salsa are some of the best I've ever had and the barbacoa de puerco is my favorite.

Great place.  Wonderful service.  I have tried just about everything on the menu and have never been disappointed.  Some favorites are the Barbacoa, Steak Chimchanga, and the Guac!  Parking for lunch can be tough.  Don't park out back or you will either get booted or towed.  At night they do have valet parking.  Looking for a fun place to go, that won't let you down this is it.

Best upscale Mexican food in Charlotte by far.  They have two locations but this is the one we go to most often.  My favorite dish is the crap and avocado quesadilla.  Table-side guacamole is the best I may have ever had.  Nice outdoor seating and really kind and helpful wait staff.  Unique selection of drinks, try the pineapple margarita.

Came here on a whim without reading reviews or seeing the menu since the place we had originally picked was closed. So glad we did! Not only is this super convenient to our house, the food was wonderful! I had the al pastor marinated salmon and my lovely date had the steak fajitas. I'm going to back up a bit before I talk about how great the food was to tell you I ordered a margarita FLIGHT. What?! Who has that?! They do. And they're awesome. Back to the food.. the salmon and steak were cooked to perfection! The fajitas came with carrots as a side.... unusual? Maybe. But he said it was a game changer! If you have he opportunity to try this place, you definitely should!

Cantina rocks.   You wouldn't know it from the way it looks outside, but Cantina serves up awesome food and even better drinks from south of the border. It's packed on weekends--usually with a somewhat younger, louder crowd, but it's by no means a fratty place--so make a reservation in advance and prepare to wait a little once you show up, but trust me: it's worth it.   Cantina has all you'd expect from a nicer Mexican restaurant, with a lot of the extras. You'll definitely want to order a top-shelf margarita--easily one of the best in Charlotte, if not the best. Try the Kiwi/Strawberry Special if you're up for a change; it's delicious. Good Mexican beers are on tap as well. Drink up. Everyone else is.   As for the food, I dont know where to begin or end. The chopped tostada salad is to die for if it's lighter fare you're craving. If you want some good 'ol refriend beans and pulled chicken, you won't be disappointed. My favorite? The Kobe beef fajitas. Trust me. Order this.   I'm definitely going back. What I wont do, however, is plan on having a big night afterward. The scene is fun and loud, but you're about as full and tired as you can be when the meal's over. Which is a good thing.

Was there celebrating my best friend birthday I had reservations.  We had an table on the patio there was live music which made the evening better that area is first come no reservations needed. The food was amazing and the service was great !! It was our first time I will be coming back !! I would like to go to the new park road location coming soon !!

Food was ok. However we saw two mice during the course of our 1 hour lunch today. I question the "A" sanitation rating.  Not only did management or the sever not apologize, they didn't seem very concerned. Will not be back to this location.

I have to edit my previous 4 star review down to two stars... it was purchased from the group that owns Mama Ricotta's, Bad Daddy's, Paco's Taco's and Plate Perfect Catering by some guy named Richard Campbell. Since this change in hands, the food quality has dropped off a bit. It's still good, but not as good as it used to be and for the price you pay there, that's not a good thing. The one thing that bothers me most about this place and will probably cause us to seek out a new Mexican restaurant in our area is the fact they have a "lunch" menu that's really just a shortened version of their dinner menu with no break in price. There are no "lunch specials" like you'd find at any restaurant, but especially a Mexican restaurant. We have one more "living social" type coupon we're going to use up there and then we're done.

Always a great choice, one of my favorites and I'm rarely disappointed with the food or service. The atmosphere is lively and exciting, great full bar, and incredible cantina Mexican dishes. LOVE the salmon and the mango salsa - I want to buy it by the carton!  Only con: parking is consistently a terrible experience. The valet is fine and helpful but on busy nights it's tempting to just scurry off to another place and avoid the whole mess.
Had a wonderful time celebrating my friend's birthday. The carne asada taco was delicious and the guacamole may be the best in Charlotte.

Thanks to all the Yelper's,  as we chose this restaurant for tonight's adventure.  You ask why I call it an adventure......because you never know the service that I am going to receive.  I started today's adventure via yelp, I investigated a few reviews, visited the website via yelp, and then placed my reservation online for 7pm.  Being that this was our first time here we arrived promptly at 6:54pm, we were greeted by three lovely young ladies at the hostess stand. We were seated immediately, in what I will refer to as the Tarzan room. (they must have known of my wild adventures in previous posts on yelp)  Our servers name was Ryan, he was very kind, polite, and efficient with his tasks of serving our needs of tex-mex food.  He asked if this was our first time in and of course, we replied yes. He was familiar with the specials and stated that if we needed any assistance with the choices he would be very willing to assist.  He allowed just enough time to look over the menu, and returned promptly to take our order.  Tonight's meal included 2 beef tacos, and the Mexican City Steak Fajitas. ( I have included a picture of my meal) Our drinks were Coke and water, he was very prompt with the refills.  The restaurant was very busy tonight, but the food was hot, fresh and very timely in it's arrival to our table. Unlike many of my other dining experiences, it is becoming less of an adventure and more of a tour of how a restaurant should be, efficient, and friendly.  The tortillas were very nice, fresh, crisp, and the salsa was very pleasant, not too hot, not too mild.  As momma bear says.....it was just right.  The music other Yelper's speak of was not much of a concern to us as we were in a separate room away from the main dining area. Our conversations were easily heard and was not too loud as others suggest.  When the meal came out, the portions were very reasonable, it was hot fresh, and very appealing.  My senses were blasting.  From the  sound of the fajitas, the smell of fresh cooked vegetables on a very hot skillet and the taste.....oh my it was delicious. ( It looks better than my photo as I did not want to use the flash)  The texture was very good, and I enjoyed the small side plate of fajita accessories which consisted of cheese, sour cream, lettuce, dices tomatoes, carrots, guac,  and onions. I needed more fajita bread, and our server had these delivered at no additional charge.  Based on this experience, I will provide 4 stars, it was less of an adventure, and more of an enjoyable night out.  Thanks Cantina 1511, for providing an easy and enjoyable meal, and for all you Yelper's who have not tried this place, go ahead, give 'em a try.  They have a beautiful patio, good food, nice atmosphere, and good service.  I may just have to use this experience as my gauge for 4 stars, I just can't see how tonight could have been much better.  NCFoodGuy

We've never had a bad meal here! The salsa is wonderful and so are the entrees. Make sure to get a margarita and the Nutella pie for dessert. If you haven't been here, make sure to put it at the top of your list!

Wow! Just experienced the rudest waiter in bar area! Rude before I could even ask about a drink!  There were no seats and didnt like that I was standing near his customer.  He came to apologize a few minutes later, but again with attitude! No drink for us!asking me to move nicely would have been fine!

We had a reservation at 7:30 for a party of 12 for a birthday party. We arrived at 7:20 and were told our tables were almost ready, that a previous party was finishing up at our table. Not a problem. 815 we were still waiting and the manager said she had an idea, she could place a table at the end of the booth, but it was going to be too cramped, then she suggested 2 booths, splitting up the party, which defeated the point of being all together for a birthday party. The manager was nice but the hostesses were very rude and snotty behind our backs as we waited to see if our original reserved tables were ready. We heard the hostesses bad mouthing our entire party, mainly the birthday girl, and were very upset with how they were talking about us with us right there. We addressed the situation to the same manager who was helping us and she apologized and said everyone was on edge because the owner was in that night. Really? I'd hate to see service on a night he wasn't there! About 830 we finally sat down at 2 different booths against what we wanted, but it was late and we were all hungry. You would think that with the problems this far service would be top notch, WRONG! We waited another 10-15 mins before our waitress even came to see what we wanted to drink, then took forever to receive waters, and a bucket of beer. We were right next to the bar, we would have had faster service walking up to the bar individually. We were promised free guacamole for our troubles with the RSVP but that too seemed like it would never come out. Our other table had a little better service then we did from another waiter. Our other table received their food before ours was even ordered, we finally got our food around 915-930, few orders wrong and the birthday girls food was nowhere to be found. Another manager walked by and we had had it at this point. We addressed the food and drink issues and how long we had been there, drinks and correct food came out very quickly after that. But before that our waitress came over and yelled at one in our party who's food came out wrong. She said it was his fault and she asked him 4 different times what he wanted, well why in the hell did it come out wrong then?! The nerve of her to yell at a customer! The original manager came over towards the end of dinner and told the birthday girl she hoped her night got better, laughed at us and walked away. Rudest service hands down. We did get some of our bill comped, but by then it didn't matter, food was cold, served wrong or not served at all, and all by the rudest wait staff in Charlotte. We will never attend Cantina again and plan on making a complaint with the owner and telling all of our experience.

Won't go back I got the shrimp fajitas (pretty simple right?) at lunch and for 30$ I got 6 shrimp and a huge pile of onions/peppers and other random veggies.....table-side guac was bland and tasteless

Probably one of the worst Mexican restaurants I have ever been to I ordered the shrimp fajitas pretty simple right ? wrong!! $30 and I got maybe six rubbery shrimp on a bed of what looked like every vegetable in the refrigerator that they wanted to throw out along with the guacamole that wasn't good along with the salsa that tasted like it was nothing more then canned tomato sauce - needless to say I will not be back

Aside from the delicious food, this place is BEYOND dog friendly! We showed up with our two pups and were greeted with custom 1511 dog bowls for water and bags of treats and toys that we can take home. Our dogs have already requested we come back.
Good food but pricey for Mexican food. Cantina gave me a free dessert for this review though so that was nice. Will be back.

I had been to Cantina 1511 once before and wasn't really impressed with that experience.  This experience was much better.    This time I sat at the bar about 1 1/2 hours before closing time.  I asked the bartender what they had in local beers - OMB's Copper on draft and Foothills Hoppyum in the bottle.  Ok.  This wasn't starting out well.  Do they know about the local craft beer craze?  Moving on, I don't remember what I had the last time I was here so I asked the bartender what she would suggest and it was a pork taco where you make your tacos with the  toppings provided on the plate.  I asked if i substitute crunchy corn shells instead of the flour tortillas and she said I could do that.  This was a wonderful recommendation.  The flavors from these tacos danced in my mouth.  Also the best place for the beans and rice were on the taco.  People who have read my reviews know I am not a big beans and rice person because they often lack in flavor but not here.   The salsa was great here as well.  Just the right amount of heat.  The chips could have been better.  It appeared they were from out of a bag because all I received were broken pieces.  But overall, this was a great experience.

Why didn't I think of this idea first? An upscale Mexican restaurant that's independently owned (they own Mama Ricotta's as well). This Mexican food will come with a price, but I promise you'll be very impressed with the taste.  They have some very unique Mexican dishes & you aren't going to see your ordinary Mexican menu items. They add their own flare to each dish & I'm not sure I've ever had a better enchilada dish than here. I'm not sure what sauce they use, but it sets it off. They also make the guacamole in front of you & they add a little spice to it as well. Once again, I don't think I've ever had better guacamole.  Cantina's food comes with a price, but it truly is worth it. This beats the upscale Mexican chains by a long shot. You'll leave this place impressed & wondering to yourself why you didn't think of this first.

We have been fans for a long time, especially at the old location.  However, last night and the last couple of visits have been extremely disappointing.  We are salad lovers, and the 1511 salad has always been our favorite, but not since the relocation.  Salad was bland and served with three slices of chicken (as ordered) but the chicken was overcooked and under seasoned.  Margarita seemed watered down.  The kids menu for our grandchildren was much better than our dinner.  I really hope they can bring this restaurant back to the wonderful restaurant it was before on East Blvd.  I miss it.  The chips and salsa are very good.  Service is very good, but the food, not so much!

Lunch was awesome!  It's better than average for this type of cuisine.  Place was clean, fun, festive...the service was a complete 10!  Food was great, portions are more than enough, very fresh!  Easy parking.  I'll be back with more friends

This is the cutest place ever.  I will start by saying the food,  awesome!!! .  I attended the place for a group luncheon for about 50 people.  The organization of service sucked and they seemed to be unprepared for the party.  Many people food, including mine, came out after most were finished eating (but the food was good). Besides the clueslessness of handling a large group, the place is cute and the food is so good.  The Guacamole is to die for.

06/21/10  I don't mind dining at a chain, as long as I (and others who may have joined me) leave feeling terrific about the experience.  Our party of four (three adults and a child) decided we'd try this place out, partly bec. of the glowing write-up it received in Charlotte magazine.  I was also excited about trying Mexican French toast, as written about in Charlotte magazine's "Top 50 Breakfasts!"    As we entered the resto, we immediately noticed the comely decor of a typical modern Tex-Mex venue, and as we sat down, I especially noted that the music was very loud.  (If you'd like to experience this yourself, first take care to find a nice quiet spot- enjoy the silence for a few seconds, if you'd like- before you turn your speaker volume to full-blast, then head over to Cantina 1511's website.  I dare you to let this go on for another 90 minutes.  I DARE YOU!)  As our server delivered our drink orders, (sis and I also asked for the margarita special of the day, which was made w/ Heradura tequila), our server asked if we needed more time, to which I replied, "I already know I'm having the Mexican toast," after which the others said they needed more time.  After the others had a few more minutes to look at the menu while listening to the loud background music, our server returned and took our orders- shrimp torta for Mom, steak fajitas for sis, and the French toast for me.  No French toast, except for Sunday brunch you say?  Well, I'll have the crab and avocado quesadilla, minus the avocado, then.  (And why the heck did you not mention this when I stated my intention before?  Oh, yeah.  I forgot.  Maybe bec. you couldn't HEAR ME due to the crappy music that blared above us!!)  After a few minutes of trying to bat away a persistent fly, our chips and salsas arrived.  I took this time to ask the food presenter (not the server) to request if it was at all possible to lower the music's volume.  (Hey, it can't hurt to ask, right?)  The answer we received is that more than likely our request won't be granted, "due to keeping up w/ the atmosphere, and all."  OK, well, would you please get rid of this pesty fly, then?"  "Haha, sorry, but no."  Looking back, we should've just stood up and left...  While I can't speak for the app myself due to a corn allergy, the general concensus was that it was A-OK.  The margarita, which sis at first turned her nose up to, was not bad after I stirred the beverage stick around a few times, which allowed the Heradura tequila and fresh juices to mix.  I'd asked if the drink could be made frozen, for future reference, but no.  (See a pattern here?)  As the tequila began to work its magic, sis noted that the music volume had come down a little.  Ole!  (However, the volume went back to its original strength a few minutes later.  Que mal!)  To make a "mucho terrible" story short, the food, w/ the exception of the fajitas and margarita, left us w/ much to desire.  Mom's shrimp torta was "just another shrimp sandwich."  "But what about the bolillo?," I asked.  "Nothing special."  And this from a woman who LOVES the bolillos from our neighborhood grocery store!  Too bad, bec. the pics looked good, don't you agree?  (This seems like the case w/ the cuatro leches cake, as well, but I am getting ahead of myself.)  Nephew didn't even finish his taco, nor the fries (and how he loves fries!), and my crab quesadilla dish was just three charred triangles filled w/ too much cheese and lumps of crab here and there.  Despite my trimming off some of the cheese, I didn't even finish two!  We all pretty much concentrated on the steak fajitas, which, despite the fatty content of the meat, turned out pretty good.  (And thank goodness it did, for this pretty dish went for a pretty penny... 1600 pennies, to be exact!)    Hoping to end the meal w/ a postre (Spanish for dessert), I chose the Cuatro Leches cake, which promised four types of milk in the form of white chocolate meringue, dulce de leche crema (condensed and evaporated milks plus sugar) and the fourth?  I think there may have been white chocolate chunks, but don't quote me on it.  Two words: too sweet!  Take away the meringue topping, it's OK.  Nada especial!  Mom and sis didn't care for more than a bite, and bec. I didn't really have much to eat, I finished the dish anyway.  If you're going to try your luck w/ this dolce- skip the canned peach slices and ask for more stawberries!  Or, better yet, just pass on Cantina 1511 and look elsewhere.  Not only did I end up spending $70 on a lackluster meal, but I was in a foul mood for the rest of the day due to the blaring music, not to mention the disappointment in not having the Mexican toast (French toast w/ sweetened cream sauce).  Nowhere was it mentioned in the Charlotte magazine article, nor Cantina 1511's menu, that this selection is only available on Sundays.    Cantina 1511 is no bueno!

I really like this place. Fantastic salsa, and really good tacos. (Why did they do away with the shrimp and scallop taco, though? IT WAS AMAZING!) Service can be a little hit-or-miss, but the food is consistently good. It's become our preferred Mexican restaurant in town.
Awful experience. Bar area smelled of damp dirty towels and bar top wasnt cleaned but sticky with old salsa. Gross
I love this place! The food is fresh, and the service is great! We love taking out of town guests to cantina to give them a taste of our local food scene.

Wife loves it so we keep coming back.  I'm never disappointed but never fully impressed either.  It helps its in a great location and we usually go before a movie date.  Service is typically just ok but they usually are busy so I'm sure that's why.

It was my first time in Cantina 1511! The decor was very bright, and vibrant. There was live music on a Thursday. The employees were dancing, smiling. Very fun vibe!!  When I got there, they gave me chips and salsa. I ordered the veggie burrito. It was very delicious, and grilled veggies in the burrito was really good. Everything was $10
I would give them five stars, and the old location definitely deserves five. However the table setup at the new location is cramped, service is mediocre, and we wait longer for our food now.

**Park in the Hearst Tower & Cantina 1511 will validate your parking up to 2 hours**   The decor is beautiful!!!! It gives off a vibrant spring feel!!!! The patio seating provided a relaxed street view of the Uptown area. The Margarita was perfectly mixed -  light enough to enjoy the flavor without the strong kick from the Patron.   The duck taco (Pato Carnitas) was amazing ~ especially the kick of heat from the jalapeño & pickled onions. The shrimp taco (Tacos Gobernador) was very tasty. It's definitely a place that u must visit before it gets too hot outside.

First when you walk in the door, very friendly host staff. The cantina area is great for drinks and/or dinner, and the bartenders are friendly and accommodating as well. They make a great margarita and always have good beers on tap...happy hour is a blast! Nice place to unwind after work, lots of business people go there. Dining in the main floor is hit or miss though; food is good but wait staff needs to step it up...service is a little slow if it's filled up. Nice place for a group or family. Very kid friendly. I'd say a 7.5/10 experience combined-food, service, and cantina area.

This place was a much better option for Mexican food in comparison to Que Onda. However, it's still your typical American Mexican cuisine. I got the carne asada burrito and the steak was good. My coworkers and I shared the queso and let me tell you... we have no self control when it comes to chips and dips haha.

Always on the hunt for good Mexican food (sorry NYC has very little) brought me to this spot.   Service: Great. They were actually packed so we sat at the bar. Bartender was friendly, service was very fast.  Only complaint is the trashy guy next to us at the bar. The poor chick with him, at one point he says I bet not one woman in this place doesn't want to sleep w/m.  Me and his date both raised our hands.  Hahaa NC trash.    Apps: Great chips and salsa,  Spicy! Chicken tortilla soup -was fantastic!   Main: I had some kind of pulled pork plate, it was OK nothing I would ever order again -the pork was overcooked/burnt.  I asked the bartender what he liked and he said he had been working there so long he no longer ate there...? Not sure if that was a good or bad comment. He told me my dish was one of the most popular on the menu -but didn't directly say it was good. Being a former server/bartender I'm a little sad that this guy couldn't ball up and tell me if was the most popular dish but it sucked.  Other Main: Chicken fajitas -they looked awesome, huge portion, his only complaint was that he was not given enough tortillas   Drinks: Top Shelf Margs! Awesome. Great quality tequilla  Location: Near Uptown NC   All in all I was extremely full and felt weighted down when I left. But maybe that's the way you always feel after you stuff your face with chips, salsa, rice, beans, pork and margs.  Good spot if you are in the mood for Mexican.  Also 4-7pm they have a drink special at the bar!! Great deals.

I will have to say the veggie enchiladas my sister and I ordered were very delicious and enjoyed every bit of it.  I was also impressed when the waiter told us the pinto beans had pork in it and replaced it with black beans. As much as I would like to give this place a 4-star rating, I can't because we were not told there was a "sharing" tax!! I have never heard of place that charges you extra if you share your entree with someone, so much for curbing portion control when restaurants offer a entree that could feed a family of 5 now a days. I was not thrilled with the hidden charge until we received our bill.  If you want modern Mexican I would suggest Vida in downtown, they have yummy food and there is NO share charge!

This place is great for lunch. I heart entire lunch menus that are seafood based. Mmm.   SERVICE: Friendly, prompt, but I will say unmemorable. Though not in a bad way, I suppose.  FOOD: Crab and guac tacos with shredded cabbage salad? Count me in. Many other choices involving shrimp and crab in the quesadilla and fajita areas as well.   ATMOSPHERE: Great outside area - recommended if the weather's good.  PRICE: I spent a total of $6 on my delicious lunch. Great for a work break.  En short, are you always squabbling with your work crew for a good place to get noms at lunch time? Bring them here. You won't regret.
