The flavor of the pork was great and it was very juicy.  Last was the taco al pastor.  Slow cooked pork with shredded cabbage, roasted pineapple, habanero crema and fresh cilantro.  I thought the combination of the pork and pineapple would be interesting and it was.  This taco was good, but didn't quite do it for me.  I'd probably double up on the carne asada or carnitas next time.  The plate came with tortilla slaw, vegetable rice and beans.  The sides were all pretty good and a nice compliment to the meal.  To me Cantina 1511 seems to be a hip, trendy place, but I'm a middle aged fat guy. I was very skeptical and prepared to not like it, but Cantina 1511 serves some very good food.  The service was excellent and the prices were very reasonable.  I learned my lesson here, don't judge a restaurant by it's trendiness, judge it by the food it serves.  And for Cantina 1511 it serves some very tasty food.
Great food and service the menu covers a wide variety of taste and flavors this place is great we came back for brunch and OMG and waiter Manny was the best we will be back again and again

The menu was varied, not the same old "rice and bean" Mexican fare. The food was awesome and the wait staff attentive but not constantly hovering and being intrusive. A great date place, business dinner, or fun night out on the town, I highly recommend if you are tired of the cookie cutter Mexican restaurant

Just had lunch there and sat at the bar. Bartender was awesome! The food was outstanding! My first time there and I had the chicken chimichanga......best I have ever had! Great prices too! Manager was awesome too.....made sure everything was great and gave me an appetizer card for their table side guacamole for my next visit! I highly recommend this restaurant!

I've been to Cantina 1511 several times (both at the old East Blvd location and the new Park Rd location) and it never disappoints.   I'm a big fan of their tacos. I think they revamped they're menu since I was there last because I think there were way more taco options than before. I got the Angry Bird (Buffalo chicken) and the That Chili glazed shrimp tacos. Both were fantastic. I might have liked the shrimp one slightly more, but it's hard to pick one.   We went for lunch and out was pretty crowded. The service wasn't the fastest, but that's understandable considering how crowded it was.   I'll definitely be back again in the future!

We went  right before they were closing and ordered take out from the bar. The bartender was nice and attentive, and even though they were closing he still took time to explain options. My drink was good and I didn't feel rushed. I would definitely return because of the service alone. I ordered Tacos, they were okay, I want to try them again dining in hopefully they are better.

This was the first dinner we had on a recent trip to Charlotte to visit friends. Cantina 1511 was recommended by my friend's coworker so none of us really knew what to expect. The food was much more high end compared to what I was expecting, so if you're looking for a good ol' messy cheese covered burrito, this probably isn't the place to go. They had a really good looking list of tacos, but I ended up trying the crab quesadilla. Per the recommendation of the waiter, I added shrimp. The server told us the chef was a great seafood cook...no disagreements here, I loved it! Very different, but if you like seafood, it's a solid meal.   Honestly, there were a lot more items on the menu that sounded amazing and I would've loved to try, but the prices were really steep. We chose to split a picture of the blue margarita and honestly, it was nothing special. When the servers (not our waiter) brought the food out, he spilled my boyfriend's drink all over him. The owner and our waiter apologized, comped his meal, and brought two fresh drinks over on the house. We compared the two side by side, and the new drinks definitely had a little/lot of extra love (and by love I mean tequila).  If you're going to drink here, skip the pitcher and go with the individual drinks.    I can't say enough good things about our waiter we had there. He also mentioned that during the summer he plays music out on the patio, so if you like live music, definitely come by in the summer to check it out. All in all: great place, awesome food and service, not the best drinks in the world.

What a disappointment!   We ordered drinks, table side guacamole, and our entrees all at once. We waited half an hour and our entrees came out. We still hadn't received our guacamole or our drinks. We would've made our waitress aware of this, but she didn't come by our table between us ordering and receiving our food. We made her aware when she delivered our food, so she went to get the other items.   The manager came out to us and apologized as they were having a busy day, and she prepared our guacamole. She gave us the Guac for free which was nice, but we also told her that we hadn't gotten our drinks (now an hour after we ordered them). We asked her to cancel them, she did, and she again apologized.   We won't be back.

Kayla is the most AMAZING server in the world. She was extremely perceptive to our needs, not hovering over us when unwanted. She answered questions regarding the menu and ensured our food was spot on. Cantina has fantastic food and would recommend to anyone, but when you add servers like Kayla you get a world class experience in uptown.

My husband and I have been regulars at Cantina Rea Rd for the past few years. Our last couple of visits have been disapointing. Our last visit was this week and I think it will  be our last. We ordered the shrimp fajitas and the Enchilada Verde. We were disapointed with both. The shrimps on he fajitas were smaller than ususal and the vegetables were thinner than any other time. The plate was full of caramalized onions.  The Enchilada Verde was not even close to the description on the menu. According to the menu, the plate is prepared with spinash and mushrooms. Yet , the plate we got was nothing but a combination of melted cheeses.   The service was ok but nothing special.

Came in as a small group of three on a Friday night. We were seated promptly as the restaurant was rapidly filling up.  The dining area is large, separated by walls and sliding doors in certain areas. Tables are close together which causes a loud environment, not the place for extremely private or intimate conversation. Unfortunately our table was right by the silverware steam cleaner and computer for all of the staff to put in orders/obtain checks, etc. There was constant traffic by our table and it grew increasingly warmer as the steamer kept being opened and closed.   The dining room seemed clean, however, the same cannot be said for the women's restroom. I am understanding of the fact that on a Friday night there is a constant flow of patrons, my suggestion is to ensure you have a staff member assessing the conditions often. Restrooms represent you and the quality of the visit just as much as everything else, especially if it has everyone in there cringing.   Our waitress was (semi) friendly at times, distracted at others, and slow moving for the majority. Once she got the idea that you were finishing your final sentence she would walk off as you completed it. Refills on drinks and chips were slow, and we never got refills on salsa...maybe I missed the fact that refills of salsa weren't a possibility? I will say the salsa had great flavor and a nice kick and the chips were warm.   They have some vegetarian options for food (all include mushroom as the main ingredient) as well as GF options (corn tortillas). I had the enchilada verde, my boyfriend the steak and chicken fajitas, and my sister the BBQ 1511 platter. I think the flavors of my dish were inventive and worked well together. I don't think it was out of this world, but I enjoyed it as an average dish with slight questions about the freshness of ingredients. My boyfriend also felt unimpressed about his dish, but my sister enjoyed hers as unique and flavorful.   The drink menu is plentiful, fun, and covers every aspect of alcohol possible. But sadly the margaritas (I had the El Dorado) seemed slightly weak. There is a nice patio if you enjoy outdoor dining.   Overall this is a slightly overpriced establishment. The pricing is not reflective on the way you receive service, the environment, or quality of dishes. If in the future all of the listed qualities bump up a notch, it wouldn't seem overpriced anymore. Overall there were positives and negatives but we still had an enjoyable evening.

If you have ONE thing here, make it the table-side guac! The tortilla soup is delicious (especially on a cold day), so after all those guac and chips, I like to have the soup for my dinner. If you like shrimp, the Marco Polo tacos are really great. Oh, and even if you don't get the guac, the salsa is tasty and the chips are warm, crispy, and unlimited. If you go on a Tuesday night, it's kids' night, so if that's not your scene, ask to be seated in the high top table section--the kiddos are usually on the other side. Outdoor seating is nice, too, when the weather is good. The food at the Rea Road location (Stonecrest Shopping Center) is just as awesome, but the atmosphere is a little more upscale. You can't go wrong at either location.

This is my 2nd bad review of this restaurant, the 1st i did via open table back in august 2014 but chose this way since it is more visible and again it is my 2nd bad review and perhaps it will be noticed more by the restaurant. My husband and I decided to do an impromptu supper/movie date night. The restaurant next door had a 1.5 hour wait, cantina had none so we chose to go there. We were sat immediately and noticed that the seating had changed as did the look of the menu. We waited, and waited at our table and were not acknowledged at all by anyone.  My husband and I are very patient, we both worked in the industry and understand things can get busy but it is expected that someone should have acknowledged us, even if it was to say "ill be right with  you". I looked at my cell phone  after being there a bit and said to my husband "if no one comes in 3 minutes were are leaving", I waited 4 and we got u p and left. We stopped by the hostess stand to let them know why we were leaving and decide to walk to one of the other restaurants in the plaza. The manager did chase us down and apologized (which was definitely appreciated and warranted) but we had a movie to catch and were not happy, it was too late. This is the 1st time I have ever walked out of a restaurant, it was the 2nd time we had a huge issue with service. I do not think we will be back, we waited a long time between our last disappointment and this time and were let down again. Again,we understand things happen but I can tell you that one of the 1st tings I learned in every restaurant I ever worked in is, patrons should be greeted in some capacity as quickly as possible (within 3 minutes).  Perhaps this is one reason they had no wait while their competitor had 1.5 hours.

I do love Mexican food, and have been to various places all over the country.  I was disappointed with this restaurant.  The service was great--the food not so much.  We ordered Margaritas.  Everywhere I've pretty much have had a Margarita, it's Tequila, a triple sec or higher quality liquor like Cointreau or Grand Marnier, and lime juice.  They use orange juice, and that's all you could taste.  I ordered fajitas.  The platter was huge, but they only gave you three tortillas. Fajita should be simple--protein, onions and peppers.  The condiment plate had pickled carrots and onions that overtook the rest of the condiments.  They could simplify the dish, and it would be better.  My companions dish was inedible.  The manager was fantastic and offers a free desert.  We got the tres leche,  one of my favorites.  It would have been good, but they added marshmallows or fluff all over the top.  Again, service was good, food I wouldn't go back.

I used this restaurant for a corporate team building dinner and paint event. There was mixup with the event coordinator who booked us at the other location. I was very stressed as I had about 30 people counting on dinner and the other location was 45 minutes away. This location was able to work with me to allow us to have the event there even though they were not expecting us. The staff was very friendly, helpful, courteous, attentive, etc. My team really enjoyed the food, beverages, and service. I would definitely come here again.

The first time I came here was a couple weeks after opening so I gave them a pass.  This go around they've been open around a year.  I ordered a birdsong ipa and the chimichangas (think super troopers).    The beer wasn't very cold, but very fresh.  The bar staff was very slow to recognize me while the bartender and manager gossiped at end of bar.   The meal came out quickly. If you want bang for the buck come here because the portion size was humongous. The meal overall was a sloppy success, I enjoyed the flavor and textures on par with any other Mexican joint.   My biggest disappointment was to see they still serve their house margaritas from buckets of pre made margarita.  Not mix and they add tequila, just communal buckets of margarita they pour all night.  Deal breaker for me, but the food may bring me back.

This was a delicious choice for dinner last night.  Based on recommendations from other Yelpers, we ordered the fresh made guacamole (which was delicious!  Maybe it's the poblano peppers?) and the "hot" salsa (which we didn't find very hot).  Our server was very friendly and when we mentioned it was our first visit, she walked us through the menu and made some great recommendations based on what we were in the mood for.  We weren't prepared for the half price pitchers on Mondays, but I did have a very tasty frozen margarita.  We ordered things from the "Authentic" side of the menu and were not disappointed. The Camarones Mojo y Ajo had a delicious unique flavor.  The Enchiladas Sulzas were very tasty, and the side of beans are AWESOME.  We also each enjoyed a taco on the side - I recommend avoiding the crispy shell (with so much stuffing it broke fairly quickly) but the Carne Asada and Carnitas Johnny tacos both were delicious.  We had enough food to feel super full (even though their desserts sound tasty too!) and I have some leftovers, too.  It was a bit pricier than we're used to paying for Mexican food which may prevent us from going all the time, but we'll definately be back!

New to the Charlotte area and I'm not gonna play the I can't give something 5 stars cause nothing is perfect gig. I have it 5 stars because for what it is the place has perfected their craft. Valet parking recommended otherwise parking is tight around dinner time. Our waiter Carlos was energetic and very knowledgeable of all the dishes. Suggestions were appreciated because it lead to try duck for the first time.  We ordered the table side guac because of how good we heard it was and they made it to your preference right there next to you. My girlfriend got fresh margaritas, and chicken enchiladas which had a spinach and cheese filling and a queso sauce on top. I ordered 3 tacos, carne asada in chunks, duck breaded with cilantro, and shrimp and scallop with a spicy sauce. All equipped with taco kickstands when you need a break. They're size is deceiving, they're super filling. All the toppings were fresh, taste buds were tingly.   Portions were big enough to fill you up and bring home leftovers. Overall an excellent dining experience. Will be going back for sure.
Great Mexican food in Charlotte.  You have the choice of traditional mexican or tex-mex.

Okay so we walked in on Saturday evening at 5:20 pm. There were probably a total of 5 tables occupied in the entire restaurant one of those being on the outdoor porch. We requested a seat on the porch and the hostess said that she couldn't seat us because there were people with reservations coming in. The place was deserted. I clicked on open table and there were reservations available for 5:35 and on. Seeing how we were turned away we were not interested in eating there. We walked right across the street and went into to Vida and were happily seated on the patio no problem.

We went to Cantina 1511 for dinner before a concert at Spectrum Center. We did not have reservations which was our first mistake. The hostess promised us though that we would be seated with 20-30 minutes.  We checked with the hostess stand after 35 minutes and we're told we'd be seated soon. A full hour after we entered the restaurant we were seated. My assumption is that they were short- staffed because as we were escorted to our table, we passed several open tables.   Our waitress was relatively slow to get over to our table and we were prepared to order immediately since time was running short. We told her we were in a hurry so we could go to a concert and she told us that it would be hard to get drinks from the bar or food from the kitchen within an hour.   We settled for water and appetizers, neither of which was very good. I am at a loss to figure out how a restaurant can't staff servers and the kitchen/bar knowing there is an event nearby.

Just ordered take out from them tonight. They said it would be ready in 20-25 minutes and we literally live across the street so we were there at 20 minutes. The food must have been sitting for a while because the food was cold and needed to be reheated. The 'bowl' of soup had two small meatballs in it. The 'pint' container it came in was also not filled and was a good inch from the top. I called and the person who answered said it came with two meatballs and that was the right container. The other food was decent but we probably won't be going here again.

Pros:  Hearty portions. The chicken fajitas are decent but the chicken was dry the last go round.   Burritos are giant and the queso version is ridiculous. Wear your stretchy pants ;)   Full bar with daily drink specials   Salsas are good but do wish they had a bit more spice.    Cons:  Their "gluten free" chips are just Tostitos that we're not fried  Crowded and sometimes slow service   Their house margarita is crazy sweet.

This place has gone down hill. At least this location.  It was like a McDonald's playroom.  Screaming kids and bright colors everywhere.  The back room is literally like stepping into chucky cheese...we were there for a ladies night out and they tried to seat us smack in the middle of that junk. It was horrid.  We requested another seat and it was slightly better.  Our server was sweet and the guacamole is still good.  However, my tacos and whole dish came out cold, flavorless and nasty.  The wine list is brutal and the prices don't make sense.  It used to be this cool trendy spot but honestly since it has changed into a playpen they need to adjust the menu prices accordingly.  I have zero desire to come back. Stonecrest might be better but I highly doubt it.

I gave this place 4 stars strictly based on their table side guacamole.  That is a true test when it comes to a "mexican restaurant" and Cantina definitely doesn't disappoint when it comes to their guac!  It is fresh, flavorful and spiced to perfection!    As far as everything else is concerned....it is just OKAY, in my opinion.  It is a trendy, mexican-fusion restaurant so you get what you pay for...and you pay quite a bit!  Everything is typically pretty fresh and tasty but I don't know if the prices are justified.    Maybe it's just me, but I can't fathom valet parking and waiting an hour for mexican food.  I like my mexican food straight up, authentic and dirty and so the "hype" around this place is just a little corny to me.    The parking lot is too small for the volume of guests but they DO take reservations so that is a good thing.    All in all it is a fun, good place to eat but make sure you have realistic expectations before going!  And, remember--the guacamole alone is worth the visit!

I've been to this Cantina 1511 location several times and I haven't been disappointed yet. When you first arrive, they'll bring fresh salsa (hot or mild) with crispy tortilla chips. I love their tortilla chips. They're so light with just the right amount of salt. And there house-made salsa is so fresh and delicious. I recommend the Prima Guacamole that is made tableside. It has fresh avocados, tomatoes, lime juice, and sea salt. It's one of my favorite appetizers. The Baja Fish Tacos are good too. They are grilled fish with shredded cabbage, lime, yucatan onions, and a sweet and spicy mango aji amarillo sauce. It is nicely seasoned with a slightly sweet taste.  I've had the shrimp fajitas here before and they are really, really delicious.  The decor is bright, vibrant, and modern with a traditional flare. They have a cool mural of Frida Khalo.  They had live music when we came on Sunday. The musicians were talented and one guy sang some of his original music.  They last time that I came Max was our server. He was so personable and  attentive. The portions are usually big enough to share.
Very nice Mexican restaurant. The portions are big and the price was reasonable. Great selection of Margaritas. Make sure to call for a reservation and parking can be a little tricky.
Best Mexican spot in town! Jamal is an awesome server, the food is very authentic, the ambiance is very classy but relaxed. I've tried all the Mexican restaurants, and none can beat this one

I want to start off my review by saying we really like the food here.  The chicken tortilla soup and fajitas are great.  Now to the problem.  We were given a $50 gift certificate to Cantina 1511 for xmas and went there Sunday 1-11-15 to use it.  After ordering a few drinks and fajitas our bill was $33.  We were told by the manager that the remaining balance of $17 was not redeemable and we would lose it.  Why couldn't they just give us another gift certificate for the balance???  The manager told us "she just works here and that's the way it is".  I'm not sure why they can't join the rest of the world and use gift cards, but it left a bad taste in our mouths and we may not return.

Had the Pina Margarita and Mexican BBQ Pork. Both were delicious and I had so much food.. I couldn't even finish all of my pork, but I definitely tried it was so good. Our waiter was super friendly, overall a great experience!

Cantina 1511 is a very nice Tex-Mex restaurant. The service was great. Our waiter was very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu. The ambiance screams modern mexico with an American twist. From the outside walking in, Good luck finding parking, I had to park on the street because parking is limited. Luckily the neighborhood is a pretty good one so I had no problem with that. I had the "Enchiladas de Pollo" which was pretty damn good to me (it was plated nicely/ could of been better but I'm not picky about that). Yes, it was on the cheesy side but I like cheese. The chicken was a little dry, that's were all that cheese came into play. I think they would of had a 5-star dish on their hands if they brined the chicken first and then grilled it. Overall I was happy with my dish. The dinner party I was with had the some of the dishes pictured, 1. Chimichanga (looked F'n Delicious) 2. Ancho Chicken Quesadillas (the chicken chunks were actually pretty big). No one complained about their food but I can say the prices were moderately higher than your average Mexican restaurant, that would be a major downfall for me to go back to Cantina on a regular basis. If your ever in Charlotte of course I would inform you to check out this place for any special occasion. Just make sure your ready to spend a little more on Mexican food.

What a great combination of Authentic Mexican and Tex Mex.  The wait staff is great, the food is excellent, the bar specials are good, and the overall experience is solid.  The parking is somewhat of a challenge, but you just work through it.

After seeing a movie, we decided to check out Cantina 1511. We arrived around 6:15 on a Sunday night and were quoted a 10 minute wait so decided to hit the bar. We ordered two house margaritas which were awesome! We were paged after about 15 minutes and seated. Once we were seated we received chips and salsa and asked if we needed a drink refill, which we did. After reviewing the menu, we chose the pork tacos and chicken fajitas. While we waited we enjoyed the fresh chips and salsa, which had a kick, which I loved. The smell in the restaurant was great so we were anxious for our food to arrive. The pork tacos were amazing! The pork was moist, almost melt in your mouth and had chopped pineapples which added a great flavor. And, the fajitas, best I have had in a long time! Piping hot, great grilled veggies, and accompanied with warm tortillas and a great assortment of sour cream, cheese, guacamole, and a few other items. What a great experience and I look forward to getting back to this location!

Unfortunately since Cantina has moved from East Blvd to Park Road Shopping Center it has not been the same. I have visited multiple times since the relocation and haven't updated my review because I wanted to give them a chance but unfortunately I cannot say that it has. This most recent visit prompted me to update my review. I arrived on a Wednesday evening with no wait, great. Chips and salsa were delivered and we ordered a few margarita's. I chose the house, the Casa Margarita, and was told it was premixed. Well, let me tell you, horrible! It is so sweet that I actually sent it back. Decided to go ahead and order a Corona, arrived with no lime, really??? As for the food, I ordered two tacos, chicken and pork, both great. But unfortunately I ordered rice and beans and the rice was so bad I cannot even explain it. And, the fact that they placed the beans in top of the rice, which should never be done, did they know the rice was bad...trying to cover it up? Wrong!!! Overall, there are too many Mexican restaurants that this is not on my go to.
Great food- not your usual, ho-hum menu. I had fish tacos- good flavor, fresh and oh, so yummy! Will definitely go back....again and again! Staff is excellent, as well.

Great lunch today!  The nachos were some of the best I have had, the hot salsa was spicy and tasty, and the service was impeccable.  This was my first time eating here and I will definitely make a point to come back.
Neighborhood  , good food, lots of beers on tab, and specially kid friendly!! Winning!

Stopped by here over the weekend after a movie.  It was about 10pm so I can see why the service wasn't that great.  It didn't take long to get a seat, but it took forever to be acknowledged by a server.  We sat out in the patio, which is probably the best part of the restaurant that night.  It shares the patio with Firebird next door, and they had an acoustic guitar guy playing.  It's great ambience.    Since we filled ourselves up with movie popcorns and soda, we didn't per se have dinner.  We shared the tortilla soup and the shrimp & crab ceviche.  The ceviche was ok; the soup wasn't much to write home about, it was more like a tomato veggies soup than tortilla soup in my opinion.  For beverages, I had a white sangria which was more sweet than strong.  His dragon something was very much like a mojito and was better than my drink.  All completed with a set of dirty silverware.    In all, Cantina serves the purpose of a decent place to eat that has some kind of an atmosphere.  Definitely not the best of anything, but it's an ok option.
Enjoying lunch with teacher friends and the best server at Cantina 1511 - Uptown! Thanks Jessica!

Cantina 1511 is new uptown. We went for a weekday dinner. When we arrived we we're greeted and seated at the bar quickly. Our serve forgot to take our order so we asked someone else to. When ordering I asked about a sauce the description I got was very vague. Our food arrived in good timing and was alright. I asked for a to go box and our waiter once again never brought me one. I'd say overall the food was okay but the service made the experience worse.

Yes, I go here often.  This is an easy meal out with a variety of options and so far, all I have selected have been delicious.  I order gluten free as I have celiac disease and they always prepare my food safely.  A huge huge HUGE plus is that they have a dedicated fryer for their chips- so I can eat basket after basket after basket with their delicious and slightly smokey house made salsa.  I usually order the Marco Polo taco because, why wouldn't i? I often get another taco and the fish one is great as well as he classic beef one.  Their salad you can get is delicious on the side and the rice and beans are pretty good.   I like their margaritas and feel they are just strong enough.  Sitting outside is great and inside can be a bit loud.  Depending on timing, there can be long waits. I will keep returning regardless.

This use to be a fantastic place! I loved it, however with my most resent visit I can tell that something has changed and it wasn't good. The menus were different as well as the friendliness of the staff and the quality of the food. We waited for 45 minutes and my fries were ice cold and my black bean burger was extremely bland. It's so not what it use to be and that's so unfortunate. I won't be returning there are way better Mexican restaurants in the area.
Food here is very good, about as authentic as your going to find in Charlotte. Try the tacos (the al pastor is pretty good) and the agua fresca.

The Pomegranate Margarita coupled with Cantina's chips and queso makes this one of my top destinations for pre-party activities.  Plus the ladies at the bar are super nice!  The place is always packed & the steak fajitas are a tried & true favorite.

If you are in the mood for Mexican this is NOT the place for you!  Sure they have margarita's and even a few Spanish words on the menu but that is really where the similarities end.  I was there on a Saturday night and the place was busy, so that could be why the service was brutal- we had to ask for things multiple times before they came and the waitress wasn't familiar with the bar or even the menu.  As for the food I ordered a chimichunga it was okay but I wouldn't order it again.  It was as if they are trying too hard to make it different, if that's the case the succeeded.  However, I think they should have focused on making it better.

Delicious!  Went here for a work dinner, and started off with a Mojito. Handmade in front of me, very good. Non of that pre-made mix crap!  Salsa and chips are excellent, we did not order appetizers though the guac, and croquets sounded amazing!  I ordered a steak burrito, with the queso on top...Um muy bueno! The burrito was warm, with a thick tortilla, and I was surprised to even find peas in it! The queso on top was a lovely creamy addition, and there was plenty of side items, lettuce, tomato, guac, sour cream if you needed them. Also on the side was their coleslaw, this stuff is amazing, I absolutely loved it.  I will definately be back soon!
The waitress is friendly.the food its ok the reason for 3 star after i order tacos the food take 35 minutes ta get in my table. I will back again for second chance
Seafood tacos with peanut sauce and fish tacos with tartar sauce were great. Service very friendly and attentive. Definitely a jem!
Authentic? Not so much. The atmosphere was cool and modern. Nice seating areas. However food was definitely not authentic. Good guacamole and chips... if I had to go back that's all I would get.

Rea Rad  location has insufficient parking forcing valet parking. Enchiladas Rojas are barely edible. Food over priced. Waiters push margaritas as if they were made with gold. This restaurant is all marketing/ brand  hype with forgettable food. Why is there not a "zero star" rating?

The food was so bad! I ordered two guacamole bowls, and it tasted like someone dumped a load of salt into both of them!! I also ordered the chicken chimichanga. It was full of black beans and little to no chicken at all!! Not to mention, the guacamole sides that came with the chimichanga was so small (maybe a pinch of lettuce and a teaspoon of the tomatoes). Compared to the CANTINA 1511 at the Park Road Shopping Center, which is great btw, this restaurant drops far low beyond the "restaurant acceptable" range. If I had to say, McDonald's or a Chinese Buffet would probably be better than what I experienced/ate at the Cantina 1511 at StoneCrest. Never going back here again. Waste of my money. I could have gone to the Nothing But Noodles or ChickFilA across the street and actually enjoyed my food. We took a to go box home only to have it thrown away.
Barbacoa is Fantastic! cevichie/ cheese dip are wonderful! Everything I have tried is excellent!

This place is pretty good for lunch or dinner, but their brunch - yes i was shocked too - was delicious!!  Service is quick and easy - thank you Melina V.! The food is wonderful and usually has you asking for a box. Great spot!   Best tip about this place: get the table side guac - superb!

I guess this is my first yelp review!  Ok, so the food is good and the prices are slightly steep for a Mexican restaurant.  It has a nice modern atmosphere and not your neighborhood Mexicans restaurant feeling.  Overall I gave them a four star because the food could have tasted better and not so blah, and the prices are too high for most things.  Would I go back? Yes nit my first choice though.
Good food. Good drinks. A little pricy. Chips and salsa were great.
Great food & service! Stan the manager was the best! Love the southwestern chicken salad!
Unexpected but Cantina does a fabulous weekend brunch! The new location is stunning and the patio is great in nice weather.

Favorite restaurant, hands down. I was a frequent customer at their previous location and appreciate the increasing in parking spots here! This was the place that showed me that avocados really are amazing.   They consistently deliver delicious dishes regardless of what I've ordered. Always go for tableside guacamole, or if you're feeling cheesy: the queso is tasty as well.   Service is pretty consistent regardless of how busy it gets. It might just take a little longer when it's packed... like any restaurant.   My usual order is either an ancho chicken burrito or 2 tacos with rice and beans or the chopped salad. Favorite tacos include: al pastor, ancho pollo, and crispy shrimp BLT. You cannot go wrong with ancho pollo, I promise!
Great Mexican food with a Gluten Free menu for wifey!

I hate to come off as a prude and I apologize in advance, but I too am very critical of mexican food. Cantina 1511 is much more about ambiance and being seen/seeing people. Its a trendy resturant but that isn't necessarily a bad thing. Service here is good and they have a multitude of drink selections, sangrias, margaritas etc.  On my last dinner visit I had the special, chicken enchilada suizas. It was not very good. The sauce was a watered down green mole and the enchiladas were not cooked to a perfection. They weren't buttery flaky and didn't melt under my fork. The chicken was bland, it just tasted boiled. I can say that Azteca has a better version of enchilada suizas.  Not a deal breaker, as I do like this place. Next time I'll just have to try a different dish. Great chips and salsa though and after work drinking here is a must!!!

A few months ago we visited this restaurant for dinner, weren't impressed, and I wrote a less than positive ( but accurate ) review.  Last night we decided to stop by again for cocktails and an appetizer. We sat at the bar - and left feeling completely satisfied. The only reason I'm not giving them a full 5 Stars is because we didn't order a full meal. But the guys behind the bar ( Julian & staff ) did a great job, we got our appetizer in a reasonable amount of time, the staff was friendly, our drink was good, and overall we left very pleased.

We showed up about 10 minutes to closing and they still seated us and did not give us any problems.  The only problem is we had to order our drinks right away for last call. We did get the guac made at the table.  It was good, but didn't have cilantro.  But it had a bit of spice which made it delicious.  Chips and salsa come with the table. We actually ended up getting an assortment of plates and apps family style between four of us.  It worked out pretty well.  Their house fundido was amazing.  I don't even remember what was in it, but it was a great mix.  Got a couple of tacos and a quesadilla as well.  All in all, the food was tasty.  The place has a bit of a classy feel, but not like you have to dress up.  It's a nice decor with good lighting.
Have never had bad food here. I was sad that the Maverick margarita was off the menu, but the bartender came through with an equivalent margarita.

By far one of the BEST Mexican hot spots in the Carolina's!!   The Margarita's are fabulous, and the table side guacamole has the kind of flavor that is a "close your eyes while you eat good"!!  We love their taco's especially...and always have to have the chipotle ranch. If I listed all the dishes that are our favorites... I may end up listing the majority of the menu.   We are not big fans of the dessert selections, but because our meal is so great...we are normally too full to go there anyhow (dessert)  For lunch I really enjoy the "chopped salad"...and talk about great Mexican style  c o r n....roll it a little in the chipotle ranch and you will be in flavor heaven!!  We eat Cantina 3-4 times a month....I would love to suggest frequent patron card..so those of us that are regulars could get a free appetizer every once in a while!! :+)  I do not know Frank (the owner) personally....but what I do know is that he has great restaurants in Charlotte....   Mama Ricotta's Big Daddy's Burger Cantina 1511   ...and soon to add a Taco spot somewhere near South Park Mall.

Oh Cantina! I am so shocked I haven't reviewed you yet! While I would simply love you for your AMAZING and fresh guac, you have so much more to offer. With Mexican, I am not hard to please, but I have never been let down my Cantina.    To begin, the decor mixes traditional Mexican style and chic modern flair. The lightening is at the perfect level so you can relax and truly enjoy your meal.   I have always had great service and when in doubt a tasty lime margarita and the Marco Polo Tacos will leave any visitor beyond happy and full!

Just left Cantina, everything was phenomenal, from the service to the food to the margaritas everything was on point. Piper was our server and she was beyond great! She was very knowledgable and helpful as well as a sweetheart. 5 stars for Cantina! When you go ask for Piper!

Cantina ranks up there in the places I like to visit along East Blvd.  While the businesses across the street tend to change out time and time again, Cantina seems to have weathered pretty well and has become a "go-to" staple for me whenever I am craving some good eats.  Recently visited on a Saturday for lunch and the crowd wasn't too bad.  They had streamlined there menu some and had a nice lunch menu to choose from.  I ended up having the Ancho Chicken Scaloppini & Cheese (Ancho chicken, caramelized poblano peppers and onions, melted Mexican cheeses) with a side chopped salad.  Dressing on the side, I only used about half of what they gave me but the salad was like crack and I could not get enough.  There were fresh avacados, chickpeas, jicama, greens, corn, black beans, and a whole lot of goodness packed into a small plate of salad.  The chicken on the sandwich was packed full of flavor.  My one comment was that some of the liquid from the chicken made the bread a bit soggy, but I powered through anyway.  The cheeses all melted in your mouth and I was stuffed in a good way for lunch that day.  I know this place is pretty popular in the evenings, but the one thing that I do get annoyed with is the parking situation.  It's great if you live down the street and can walk, but unfortunately the parking lot - they have done the best with what they have, but I do feel awkward parking in front of employees cars (double parking) but I think they do valet too so they can put your car wherever.  The patio is pretty amazing when the weather is cooperating.  And no visit to Cantina 1511 is complete without some tableside guacamole.

I came here for brunch on a trip. Food is good and reasonably priced. It is gringoized which isnt bad just more mild than true mexican food. Great patio area and friendly staff. Solid place to eat!  Presentation of dishes is really nice too.

I keep coming back here because I love Mexican and it it so close to where I live, but I never leave here completely satisfied.  The food is good but not always seasoned properly.  The pastor and carnitas have not been as flavorful as I would expect and the barboaca was way too salty the one time I got it.  The wait staff is friendly but seems to rush you out and can be forgetful at times. The layout is unique with a bar/lounge area and also has a front porch seating for when its nice out.  This is one of the best spots for Mexican I know of in Charlotte. However, I prefer their sister restaurant Paco's Tacos as far as the food goes. The salsa verde at both restaurants is banging!

Sub par experience. Asked to be seated in a booth, the gentleman at the door said he didn't have any available - the restaurant was half empty. Now you're telling a guest they can't sit where they want to. Who trained you? So once we sat down I asked the server if I could move to a both, she gladly show use to a large booth. I didn't mind being sat at a six-top both because I had originally asked for a booth. There was a six top sat beside us. I guess since they all ordered drinks our two-top table was obsolete. Good thing I don't work in food and beverage to notice these mannerisms. My beer took almost ten minutes to hit the table and I never got the green salsa which I requested as soon as she greeted the table. A really tall gentleman came by because I think the server might have picked up on my frustration. He brought out the salsa!! The queso is always great and I crave their green salsa - these two reasons alone is why I thought about going. All my previous experiences have been fine but they were also at the bar.
The best Mexican food in Charlotte!  The service and food were exceptional. It was some of the best salsa we've had, and the enchiladas were very flavorful.

Went for dinner last night at 8pm while the restaurant was very empty. Waited for a server for 15 minutes before going to see the hostess to ask if she could send a server over. 8 minutes later and still no server so I went back to the hostess again to tell her we were leaving. I had heard great reviews from friends about Cantina but after last night being my first time there I will never go back. Plenty of servers walked by while we were waiting but none stopped to ask if we were being helped. Completely unacceptable!

My husband brought me and my mom here for Mother's Day lunch as this used to be one of my favorite places as I loved their drinks. He made reservations almost a month in advance. When we arrived, there was an abbreviated, pre-fixe Mother's Day menu, which we were not made aware of in advance.  I was a little disappointed that I could not get the Barbacoa I'd always liked so much. We were initially a party of 3 and my son said he couldn't make it so we went ahead and ordered our food, After waiting a really long time and no food, my son suddenly appeared. We put in an order for him as well. After waiting another excruciatingly long time, a server appears with a plate of food. ONE plate. It was the dish my son had ordered. He arrived about 30 minutes after us, and got his food first. Since it just so happened that he and my mother ordered the same choice, he gave the plate to her so she could start eating as the server promised that the rest of our food would be right out. However, at the time that she FINISHED her plate and the rest of our food hadn't been brought out, I caught the eye of a hostess checking tables (as our server was nowhere to be found for long periods) and asked her to please check on the rest of our food. 5 minutes later, the rest of the food comes. My fajita platter - which was some dried out chicken and mushy peppers and a single flour tortilla, was cold. Not even lukewarm, but cold. I immediately had to flag down another hostess, again, our server was elsewhere for long periods, and asked her to get me a manager. Manager comes, apologizes for the "kitchen" mixup and says he will remake my meal. FIVE MINUTES later, I have a piping hot fajita platter in front of me, this time with TWO WHOLE flour tortillas. Yay? Nay. While it was hot, it was bland and unseasoned. Not sure how tex-mex ends up unseasoned. We were all so disappointed with this experience they completely ruined my mothers day luncheon. We are not interested in returning here again. Not even for the drinks.
Been there twice. Loved it both times. Great drinks! Busy but great service. In a good area. Tasty food.
